Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tony L
Reviews.Content: My daughter recently stayed there for st. pat weekend and had an issue with the room that was reserved. They spoke with Michael and the situation was quickly remedied to hers and my satisfaction. I later spoke with Michael also and was impressed with his professionalism and courteous demeanor. She will be back for the Wyndham name and staffing. Thanks for making my daughters stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May '10 when this was still known as Hotel Blake. Was hoping this wouldn't become part of a big chain so that there prices would stay nice and manageable. Ohh well... Being located only a few minutes from Michigan Ave and famous Buckingham Fountain, it is also located close to several different CTA stations, so getting around town is quite easy. There are a couple of entrances into the hotel. One is shared with the entrance to Custom House, a restaurant on the corner of Congress Pkwy (they make their own ice cream!!). The main entrance is closer to the middle of the block. The lobby is off the main entrance and there is a nice long hallway leading to the lobby from the secondary entrance. Between both entrances is the business center with a couple of computers and nice comfy leather chairs. The folks at the reception were nice, courteous, and professional. The room was nice and large with a king size bed, a comfy lounge chair, TV console with flat screen TV, and a comfy bench at the end of the bed. The room not only looked plush and rich, but everything actually was. The room even came with bathrobe and house slippers. The bed was so comfy after a long day of walking around town, but the warm shower before that was even more so with a nice rainfall shower head. All in all one of the most comfortable places I stayed in for a couple of days and for the price, there was no other place I would have preferred to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Showtime in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: KingKongScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Blake for three nights while attending a conference. The quality of the accommodation was very good and all staff were professional and welcoming. My room was spacious and well equipped. It was a bit noisy, but then this is a city centre hotel. Special mention should be made of one particular member of staff who made my visit memorable. The doorman/concierge "Showtime" was a one-man information centre on restaurants, transport, local attractions and pretty much anything else you needed to know! His enthusiasm and humour are a credit to the hotel and he is a valuable asset to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: Linzerella1983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Chicago in November 2011 for a five-day stay in the Windy City. It was our first trip and we plan on returning many more times in the future - and we'll be sure to stay at the Wyndham Blake. The hotel is in a terrific location - just south of many of the more expensive hotels in the Loop, close to Starbucks and super accessible to the L subway system. Our room was a terrific size, always clean, had an amazingly comfortable bed and terrific bathroom. The hotel staff were super friendly - the doorman is a total gem and helped us get a private car the one time we cabbed around the city. The area is very safe, accessible to at least three L stations and in my opinion was worth the money. There's WiFi available which is a must when I travel and the bed linens/towels/bath products were terrific. My only complaint would be the hotel restaurant - skip it, it's overrated, expensive and underwhelming - and the street noise. Our room faced South Dearborn Street and it was a bit noisy in the morning. Other than that, totally recommend the hotel and city - we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to crash!”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. I have to say it was a great stay. Hotel was clean. Nice decor. Not sure if it is like this in all rooms, but our shower had no door or curtain! It was a little weird to be all exposed like that, but I just made sure I locked the bathroom door. Also, the shower floors are really slippery when wet. I am surprised there is no matting on the floor to prevent a slip and fall. Room service is available if you wish to take advantage of it. I did not, so I can't tell you how it was. Fitness Center is available on the second floor. I did use that and I have to say it was good. They have the standard treadmill, elliptical, and bike. There is also a machine weight set too. The center was very clean and the equipment well kept. The hotel is right next to the LaSallle St. Station on the Blue Line for CTA. It was so convenient for myself! Easy to get on and transfer at other stops and it is a direct 40 minute ride from O'Hare. On thing that I didn't like was the fact that there was no type of continental breakfast. Not even pastries and coffee! I know that there is a restaurant attached to the hotel, but I don't want to spend a lot of money on just breakfast! Dunkin Donuts is right across the way, and I made good use of them! Also, I don't know why a few reviews give a thumbs down to the doorman, but I thought he was a good guy. He was very helpful and did give us some names of places to see and check out. "Showtime" was what he went by....good guy! I can't think of anything else except next time I am in Chicago, I would stay here again. Decent hotel in a decent location for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Anna O
Reviews.Content: Pictures of the Wyndham Black are deceiving. Felt it was too expensive for the experience. The concierge kept trying to get us to go to tourist attractions though we told him we visit the city all the time and already had plans. Shame on us, but at one point he walked us over to a jazz club he obviously had a deal with. He sat us in the very front where there was a two drink minimum and directly in front of the band, which was far from good. We drank our drinks, promptly left, and avoided him the rest of the trip. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: AceAnalyst
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the size and decor of our room. It had a king size bed, desk, dresser, end of bed chaise, and in front of the 3 windows, 2 chairs and a end table. Although the bathroom was huge, with a double sink, I didn't care for the shower. The shower had a rain fall shower head, this is because the shower is set up so that you are basically taking a shower behing a piece of glass that only covers half of the shower opening. While it looks cool, it certaintly isn't very functional. Other than that I loved the room. The food service was great, I ordered it every day during my stay for breakfest and the hotel staff very pleasant. It is within walking distance of everything in the Loop and only 2 blocks from the train. I took the Blue Line back to the airport no problem! Note:I accompanied my boyfriend on a business trip and he was booked to stay at the Union League Club and his room was tiny and outdated, thank god we didn't "stay" there......We will definitely stay here next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: Marina5446
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Blake for two nights and had a great stay. Nicely central. Only a 10 minute can ride from anything and everything (Museum Campus, Navy Pier, Millenium park, Union Station, etc). The staff is wonderful and the rooms are very well appointed with lovely high ceilings. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people. Nice place. Bad plumbing...”
Reviews.Author: FuninPlaya
Reviews.Content: With exception to a couple minor hiccups, it was a pleasant stay. Yes it's old and showing signs of nastalgic wear. The vents could use some dusting and the corners a fresh coat of paint but, it dismisses itself given its character. The Good: The reception, don't recall her name, we'll call her Spanish girl who has worked there for 6+ years, was so pleasant and kind. Jamie, the reception bartender, makes a mean white Russian! She was great too! All the concierge guys were great especially with small talk and eatery reccomendations. The bedding was very nice. Issues: Room card didn't work on several occasions. One of the instances was due to a payment issue. I thought the guy who was handling the problem could have come across a bit less "you owe us money'ish" but he was young and I'll chalk it up to lack of experience. The bathroom's plumbing was horrible! I'll just leave it at that. The in-house supplied hair dryer blew the wall plugs fuse and never could reset the sockets to use again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dj_jay_smith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner while holidaying in Chicago. We really liked the hotel and would stay again no questions asked. The hotel is located just a block or so south of the loop and this for us was the perfect location. Allowing us easy access to public transport and get around the city. The hotel itself is very nicely done and they obviously take care of it as they were repainting some areas when we were there. The rooms were a nice size, with big beds and well looked after. Cleanliness was always perfect and there were no issues here. We did not really use any of the facilities in the hotel, so we can't comment on this but the staff were alwasy very friendly and very helpful with all our minor requests and overall gave a very positive impression. The only negative points were the amount of light in our room and the noise from outside. Our room just had a single narrow window that did not let in hardly any natural light, also due to the building across the alley blocking most of it, and the lighting in the room also could have been better. Also, our room was located opposite the air conditioning and heating vents from a large office building which was quite noisy. These really are the only thinks stopping this being a 5 star review, as the rest of the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but our room wasn't clean.”
Reviews.Author: KellBell6644
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights right at Christmas. The room itself was beautifully decorated and large. Unfortunately the room was not cleaned very well., There was hair in the shower,and more hair on the bathroom floor, the nightstands were very dusty and there were a few small objects on the carpet that should have been vacuumed up. I was so disgusted that I had to wear shoes at all times and even wore some old crocs in the shower! We got a discounted rate on the room due to a family connection with Wyndam so we didn't feel right about complaining but we really should have.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertoNB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group for a trade show in Jan 2012. The hotel was very nice, however we were unable to get an early check-in. We had arrived from O'Hare at about noon, but our rooms would not be ready until 3. The hotel did store our bags at no cost until our rooms were ready. My room on the 11th floor was comfortable and larger than standard double rooms I have encountered. The bathroom was also a very nice size, and had been upgraded recently. There is an El stop nearby the hotel, about two or three blocks. There is a 7/11, a Chase bank, a Starbucks, and a Potbellies sandwich shop on the same block as the hotel. I ate breakfast twice at the attached restaurant, and was very impressed with the healthy options. I had granola w/ greek yogurt one morning, and steel cut oatmeal w/ dried fruit the next. Overall, I was very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence1001
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, well maintained, clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The baths were beautiful, although as others have commented, if the glass wall had been built a foot wider there wouldn't be any splash problems. However, only a tiny amount of water escaped. The rooms on the back (west) side were very quiet, although you just have a view of the wall of the adjoining property. Overall I'd probably have given the hotel five stars, but it's location was only fair. It's a good walk to most attractions--20-30 minutes to the Field, another five to the Shedd and another five to the Adler Planetarium. The Art Institute is probably the closest, about 15 minutes away at a brisk pace. Navy Pier and the shopping on N. Michigan are at least 30 minutes walk away. I don't mind a lot of walking, but most will spend some cab money, especially going out for dinner in the evening. The red line subway at the nearby Jackson stop on State Street is the quickest, most reasonable way to get to N. Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ajnrobin
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful boutique hotel! We stayed in a "Premiere King" room and it was great! Large room, excellent, double sink bathroom, gorgeous walk in shower, and the most amazingly comfortable bed! I could have stayed in that bed forever. Very nice, attentive staff. Although I will rate this 5 stars, there are a couple of things to make mention of...while this hotel is great, it is not overtly fancy. Rooms and decor were fabulous- but no minibar, refrigerators, or microwaves. Hotel bar is also only set up from 5-9pm. Although, we did receive a free drink @ the bar, included in our room price :) Location was okay...but not really ideal for Restaurants and shopping. We definitely spent a fair amount of money on cab fare, which pretty much negated the excellent deal we got on the room. All in all, Fabulous hotel, and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and courteous staff and clean spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: WaywardGeorgian
Reviews.Content: I liked it so much I'll be staying there again soon. It's a little far from some restaurants and attractions, but is no more than a 5 to 10 minute walk to most anything you need or want.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smilie62
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated room, lovely lobby, not a bad location. The bartender stayed late to serve us our free drinks on a Saturday night and everyone was so friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, nice people”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLens
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 week stay at the Wyndham Blake during an extended business trip to Chicago. I can't comment on the value for money because I didn't pay for it. But I can say that the room was spacious, nicely furnished, with a view of the city. I asked for a fridge and the friendly staff supplied one and waived the usual fee, I guess because of the length of my stay. The staff was always very helpful and concerned for my needs and informative about the area. The hotel is located in the South Loop. Its not a concentrated tourist area like the North River area, but it is an area of great classic architecture and an easy walk to the Art Institute or the Sears Tower. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent...one of the best in the area. But it is quite pricey. The room was on the 11th floor and very quiet except for the occasional police siren. The one thing that keeps me from giving the place 5 stars is the bad design of the shower (and there is no tub). The shower is separated from the rest of the bathroom by a fixed piece of glass next to the shower head, and open on the other side. In order to turn on the shower, you had to step in and turn the fixture. It was impossible to avoid getting hit by cold water for a moment. Then, when taking the shower, water would always flow down the fixed glass, along the flat divider, and onto the floor. I always left a couple of soggy towels on the bathroom floor in the morning. But this is a small price to pay for what was otherwise an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas with Showtime”
Reviews.Author: tblumka
Reviews.Content: My family decided to take a quick family weekend to Chicago to see the lights a the zoo. Little did we know the most memorable moment for our 5 year old would be the doorman at our hotel nick named "showtime" He took our little one by the hand and taught him how to hale a taxi cab. The rest of the trip that was our sons job. When we returned to the hotel he proudly ran up to his new best friend and told him all about the cabs we had gotten for us. After his high five, he got a big hug. Great hotel, great service, nice rooms, great location. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION. NICE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: benikana
Reviews.Content: hotel is well located. the rooms are very good, quite large. beds very comfortable. LCD TV. not had breakfast at the hotel, but in front of the hotel has a starbucks which was great for every day. we were driving, do not use the valet of the hotel was very expensive. but we stopped the car on the street in front of the hotel and paid $ 3 per hour. and in the evening was free. You can go to the hotel is quiet good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and affordable for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Primrose W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Prices are reasonable for downtown chicago and location is very central and close enough to walk to millennium park. I got free breakfast and free drink vouchers with my package which was a plus. With the breakfast you get a choice of hot or,cold breakfast made to order. They had an amazing power shower which was one of my favorite things. Rooms were very clean and spacious. The staff were five star, greeted us every time, gave good recommendations on restaurants and very helpful overall.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Maximumca
Reviews.Content: Switched to the Wyndham Blake after staying at a higher end hotel for 6 nights and pleasantly surprised at the quality. One third the price but quality of accommodation almost the same. Very large room and nicely renovated bathroom with double vanity and glass enclosed shower. The only down side was the toilet that sounded like a jet taking off when flushed......a minor annoyance since I was by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa W
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and my experience was okay. I was disappointed that by the time I got back from my event, there were no food or drink options available. My room seemed a little dirty--like it doesn't get cleaned well every time. I asked to get a cab and the guy looked at me like I was crazy and told me to go hail one myself. He finally came and helped me after 5 minutes of no cab. There were also not a ton of restaurant/bar options immediately nearby. It was a nice looking hotel and is nice if you like smaller hotels, but I didn't have an awesome time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but only worth it only if you get a good rate or need to be in area.”
Reviews.Author: GermanGemini
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Blake for business and it has all the basics for short-term travel: rooms are smallish but they make the most of it with an especially comfortable bed, a generous desk and an open glass stalled shower. Location is not prime for shopping but great for the park, museums and colleges. A little on the fringe of the main area so I wouldn't walk at night, but no worries during the day. Very agreeable at $150 price I got for for a conference but stayed beyond 1 day and got hit with a $250 rate! I would stay again only if convenient for business but unlikely for personal travel. Not enough personality or perks to be a favorite in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingwriter1
Reviews.Content: Big, comfortable rooms, well-appointed, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff”
Reviews.Author: ironmoose
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent one night at the Blake from Saturday into Sunday. The hotel is located in the loop. I found it to be a great location to everything. The room itself was very nice. High ceilings made the room feel huge. They have new flat screen tvs if you care about that. The bathroom is large enough for two people to get ready in the morning. The bathtub in our room was worn and had seen better days as it had a large crack/chipped area that had been plastered in. Aside from the bathtub being worn, the hotel and our room was very clean and had a modern feel to it. There was quite a bit of street construction going on, but it will only serve to enhance and improve the loop. I personally didn't hear any construction going on as it may have been halted over the weekend/Sunday. As someone else posted previously, we did hear a number of sirens, but that didn't impede my comfort or sleep at all. Speaking of which, the mattress in our room was king size and by far one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. We arrived at the hotel shortly before noon and the hotel was very accommodating and allowed us to check in as soon as we got there. Another great asset to the hotel is a certain individual whose real name is Greg, but everyone calls him "Showtime." I can say enough good things about this man. Great sense of humor and makes you feel right at home. We wanted to dine somewhere close to the hotel and he recommended a small Italian place called Trattoria Caterina. I would definitely recommend it. Prices were very good and the service was second to none. The food itself was really good as well. After we returned to the hotel Showtime asked us if we wanted to go check out a local jazz club. He escorted us around the corner and got us in for free and even a vip table right at the front. And the music was fantastic! I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you go, make sure you seek out Showtime.

Reviews.Title: “Too much street noise”
Reviews.Author: RWCJHP25419
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Blake is an older hotel in the south loop area of Chicago. The location is very convenient, within walking distance to most of the downtown area, and only a couple blocks from public transportation. The worst thing is the street noise, which starts out early in the morning with traffic and construction noises. There must be a firehouse nearby, because we were constantly hearing fire trucks go by, sirens blaring. Our first night we were in a room facing Dearborn street, and had to move to the other side of the building because of the early morning noise on the street. The other side was a bit better, but the noise level was still such that we couldn't sleep in. The staff was very helpful in getting us moved to the other room. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was very accommodating to our needs, as were the rest of the staff. The furnishings are starting so show the years, but the beds were among the most comfortable I have found in a hotel anywhere. I'm not too crazy about the rainfall shower, as I like a shower with a bit more pressure behind it, but there was plenty of hot water very quickly. I would suggest parking your car yourself; don't pay the extra for "valet" parking. Valet parking involves paying $44 a day (with in and out privileges) for them to put your car in the same garage you can park in yourself for $25 a day. It's just around the corner from the hotel, and you don't have to wait for the valet to get your car for you. The exercise room is nice and well equipped, and has a good view of the surrounding city. We did not try the hotel restaurant, as the prices seemed rather high. All in all, it was not a bad place to stay, but the amount of noise from the street would make me look seriously into finding another place near the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: stanloise
Reviews.Content: We loved the stay at this hotel, the rooms are very cozy and comfortable. Oh, how can i forget the bed in our room, i miss it every night now. I have never had such a wonderful sleep in a hotel bed, i enjoyed my room. After a long day of site seeing, we used to be excited to come back to our room, coz it was very relaxing and comfy. The hotel is on S Dearborn St which is the right place to stay if you are planning for site seeing and shopping in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: BostonianTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights during Halloween weekend. The staff at the hotel (Gina, Loren, and Showtime) were welcoming, knowledgeable, and friendly. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel is located 2 to 3 blocks from all the major train lines and a few blocks from Michigan Avenue and easy walking to Millenium Park. The price was very reasonable. Great stay! Near some great restaurants (Waffles!) a great blues club (Buddy Guy's Legend). I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: akgirl1
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel!! I am home but I miss the pillows! We had a great stay. Great location and nice neighborhood. Close to coffee, sports/casual bars and good food! The little market down the street on Saturday was a welcome treat for stocking our backpacks for our flight home with fresh WI cheese fruit and fresh bread/muffins :) The staff was really nice and friendly. Rooms were very nice and the beds and pillows very comfy! A burger at Blackie's and a beer at Kasey's should be on your list. The Custom House Tavern had a great choice of wines and good beer. We walked to Millenium Park and back. Strolled to State St. Friends took nice runs in the morning. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MagairlinMeireach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while on business in Chicago in October 2011. My main criticism of this hotel would be that it is expensive. However that may be unreasonable given the prices of other hotels in Chicago. On the positive side, it is close to a subway station that links directly to O'Hare airport and is within walking distance of the centre of Chicago. The staff are friendly and the rooms are good. There is a small fitness centre that is convenient to use. I didn't take breakfast in the hotel but there are plenty of good-value breakfast options nearby. A final negative point is that roadworks nearby made access to the hotel a little difficult. I imagine these roadworks will continue for three to six months after October 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Columbia College Parents”
Reviews.Author: SCSWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at numerous hotels in the area while our son looked at various colleges before selecting Columbia College and now we only stay at The Blake. The location is great for meeting our son and close to subway if we want to venture further. The in and out parking is reasonably priced and quite handy when we take our son to Costco to refill his frig and visit his favorite restaurant, Kumaâ€™s Corner, which is not easily reached by subway. The rooms are nice sized, clean and quiet upgrades appear each time we stay. The staff is consistent; I think the same person picks up the phone every time I call for reservations and even the bell person seems to remember everyone. If we encounter a problem, it is addressed right away â€“ only happened once but was resolved to our satisfaction. It has a feel of nice small boutique hotel rather than large overblown chain. We had some concerns when it became a Wyndham, but the fears were ungrounded and in fact improvements have been noticeable. The nightly rates seem to fluctuate each time we stay but I check other hotels and they are below surrounding hotels. During the winter, we received some unbelievable rates. There is also a special rate for Columbia Parents â€“ this is our hotel of choice, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- missing some amenities”
Reviews.Author: firefly021
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for my own wedding. Almost all of my out of town guests stayed here as well. I found the hotel to be quite nice in terms of the actual room- it was spacious, had quality bedding and towels, and good bathroom products. I found the staff to be nice but a little pushy. The location was fantastic and many people really enjoyed being close to all the attractions. However, several of my guests exclaimed "this might be the WORST hotel I've EVER stayed in" because there were no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms. For the amount of money we were paying it was terrible that those sorts of amenities were not included. Moreover, when I called to ask about the refrigerators the front desk told me I could "rent one for $30 a day." Seriously? You've got to be kidding me. To top it off most people ended up leaving their cars in other lots because the hotel charges over $40 a night for parking- that just seems a little bit exorbitant. I would not stay here again for full price.

Reviews.Title: “Showtime!”
Reviews.Author: maddoctormaryse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Printer's row and has an old hotel feel. The rooms are lovely, spacious and comfortable, but don't have refrigerators. We stayed on the 3rd floor. I think the hotel is actually 2 buildings connected to each other so some of the rooms on the same floors are actually half above and half below you. Consequently, there's a lot of noise during the day, feet scuffling and walking, etc. Also, since the room is close to the street, every ambulance passing is like an alarm clock ringing. The location's ideal for business travelers, I guess, since it's closer to the financial area and most of the "tourist-y" sights are a bit farther but still accessible. There's a breakfast voucher for the restaurant next door although the food there is a little blah... The staff is very helpful and nice, especially the night doorman "Showtime", who was always helpful in suggesting restaurants and eateries. Had a great stay and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and classy”
Reviews.Author: Namealreadyinuse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Blake to attend a conference at the Chicago Hilton. (The Blake was 3 blocks away and $50 per night less) The Blake is wonderful and beautiful, an older hotel that has been updated in a classy way. The employees were gracious and helpful. The room was well-appointed and spacious. The bed and pillows were tres comfortable. In all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Suzl4
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Wyndham Blake and each time I've had a good stay. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in a great part of downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Phillypam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Chicago, and we were so thrilled with our hotel, the Wyndham Blake. The room was a very good size. Our friends stayed in the Palmer House Hilton and their room was a closet compared to the Blake. The bathroom only had a shower, which was fine for us but may not be for other people. Nice little gym (2 treadmills, two ellipticals, some small free weights) overlooking the city. Great food at the custom house, right next door to the hotel (lemon grits that they serve with breakfast were so great!). Great friendly service at the front desk, and the maids were excellent--they didn't cut any corners when cleaning. A few blocks from shopping on state street. It is a bit on the outskirts of the loop but definitely still close to everything. Loved it and would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but can't get a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: maryd4
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were great. Rooms on Dearborn St side get lots of traffic noise. Was so loud I thought the window was open. To top it off the bed springs were so creaky I couldn't roll over without waking myself up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great room, helpful staff, excellent location very noisy outside saturday night late!!”
Reviews.Author: Renatabaltimore
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in July. The room was large and very comfortable. It was in an excellent location for visiting Millenium park and the art museum. It was extremely hot outdoors but the air conditioning worked beautifully The staff was helpful and the doorman delightful. The small continental breakfast of home made tasting muffins,fruit and coffee served in a lovely restaurant (dinner there was excellent) was adequate. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and Room in Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minic00per
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Blake is a small boutique type hotel located in the historic Printers Row section of the South Loop, within walking distance of all the Loop's attractions. The Blue Line from O'Hare drops you off just 2 blocks from the hotel (45 minute ride for $2.50) and there is also CTA bus service very close to the hotel which we used to go to the Loop as well as the museums to the south. Our room was bright and quite large considering it is in an historic building. I expected a small room with inadequate lighting but this was sure not the case. Bed, linens and pillows were wonderful as was the decor. Our room was large. It looked out on Dearborn and I expected to hear noise at night but it wasn't a problem at all. We slept like a top. Good insulation plus darkening drapes helped, I'm sure. Nice bathroom with a large shower with a "rain" type shower head. Great water pressure. Free internet. Staff friendly and helpful. The doorman gave us his card which got us into Andy's for jazz without a cover charge. Adjacent restaurant and a lobby bar although we didn't use either. Hotel's restaurant is quite pricey but there were plenty of reasonable eating options within a block of the hotel as well as a Starbucks right across the street. Room had a very large flat screen t.v. We felt this hotel was a great option for the money and will stay here again if we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel right downtown”
Reviews.Author: MontyK
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago for a short little working vacation and chose the Wyndham Blake for three reasons: price, location, amenities. It's right downtown, walking distance to everything you want to tour in Chicago, the art gallery, the main shopping, plus it's perfectly easy to walk north to the club district. Blue and Red line subways are a few easy minutes walk. For price, it's hard to beat. I know people have complained of noise or construction, but even with the road dug up right outside I didn't notice a lot of noise you wouldn't find staying in any other big American city. Plus, I woke up one morning to find an entire painting crew outside my door and I hadn't noticed! Noisy? Hardly. This was the cheapest price I could find that included the two amenities that mattered to me most - free WiFi and continental breakfast. I hate having to pay for internet (cheap hotels it's free, expensive ones charge - how does THAT make sense???), so Wyndham had free, reliable internet. The continental breakfast was little more than a pile of muffins and some fruit (oranges and apples on my visit) and some coffee/tea. I love a big luscious breakfast as much as the next person, but for those who just want to get something to eat, caffeine-up and go, this is perfect. Gripes? None really. The front desk staff were really pleasant and helpful. I didn't try the restaurant, instead heading to the nearby Hackney's for their local beer selection (and KILLER friend onions) or Bar Louie for a great tex mex dinner. I will be back. Oh, did you know you can take the subway from the airport??? Do it, save yourself the $$$ in a taxi or shuttle. It's super easy. I wish I knew!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Exellent service! The rooms are marvellous, and the internet worked fine all the time. I also recommend the coffee in the rooms (a small coffemaker and coffeepods, also free.)No complaints at all. Will come back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: JP39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in late August. Great room, very comfortable. Liked the bed, sheets, nice bathroom. Extremely helpful front desk staff. Continental breakfast is poor though -- muffins and coffee, nothing else (although the blueberry muffins were loaded with berries). We just got a coffee and went out for breakfast. Had a view of the cool library across the street. There was road work going on outside, but the noise was minimal and did not bother or wake us. We liked the location, just a couple blocks away from the El, choice of two stops. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel - but barely average service”
Reviews.Author: Erin P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was unique and pretty - nice large rooms, lots of character. We were there for our honeymoon and they offered to upgrade us to a suite to celebrate. But in order to do that, we needed to wait 3 hours before checking in to clean it. So, we went to explore the city. When we came back, we checked in and found that we were not upgraded at all - just a normal room with a 3 hour inconvenience. Instead of restocking for towels/toiletries, they simply removed the used. By the last day, we had one shower towel and no toiletries left and had to request more. Restaurant was closed, breakfast was just barely average dried pastries and apples - we went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay while in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! The staff was welcoming, kind, courteous, and extremely helpful. The room was immaculate. My entire stay was a 100% positive experience and as I just moved my daughter to college in Chicago, this hotel will be my number one choice to stay for at least the next four years!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: TheJuggernauts
Reviews.Content: I randomly selected this hotel during a last-minute trip to Chicago and we were pleasantly surprised. The massive windows were the first thing we noticed when we walked into our room. Spectacular views! Our room had enormous ceilings and the room was overall generously sized. The bed was cozy and the room was very clean. We were a short walk away from several restaurants and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, convenient to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Wyndham Blake Chicago. The lobby area was very nice although a bit small. The room was large and luxurious. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was huge. The location was convenient with two â€œELâ€� stops close by and many bus routes to the various tourist spot that run on a consistent basis, takes about 5 minutes to get to the Art Institute, 10 minutes to the Shedd area, 20 minutes to Navy Pier. Only four blocks from the famous Buckingham fountain, Grant Park and the lake shore. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Canâ€™t wait to visit Chicago again and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: ProfPayne
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel in an old building on the historic register. It's right in Printer's Row so well located. What impressed me most about the hotel was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. There really went above and beyond, including moving us from a claustrophobic room with no view to a real gem! I suspect they upgraded us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Flying_is_evil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small but very nice looking. The "deluxe king" rooms are very tiny, large enough for a bed and desk but not much more. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the room or evidently on the property. The free breakfast is just flat out pathetic. Your choices are fruit or mini-muffins that's it! Good luck ordering off the menu, we sat for 20 minutes and the sole waiter never even came by. We finally got up and left as did the table that came in after us. I think the reason this hotel is soo expensive is it's location, but even that isn't all that good. The navy pier is still a good 2 miles away as are most of the museums. It's only a great location if you need quick access to about a dozen parking garages! Speaking of parking, do NOT drive to the hotel. Parking is $44 a night EXTRA!!! We took a train in so this didn't affect us but be aware of it! Next time we do Chi Town we will be staying at a hotel in the burbs and then taking the very efficient train system to where we need to go.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: srcrmcky
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an over-night stay in Chicago for the Rock n Roll Half Marathon. I booked this hotel because it was reasonably priced (for a weekend stay in downtown Chicago) and relatively close to the start/finish line of the race. I was pleasantly surprised by the genuine friendliness of the staff. Everyone I encountered was exceptionally pleasant (and not fake) as well as very helpful. I was also thrilled to be able to have access to my room when I checked into the hotel at 1pm. The hotel appears to have been recently refurbished, everything was crisp and clean. The only downfall I noticed was that the rooms only have a sheer curtain cover and the thicker curtain does not cover the entire window...therefore I was unable to block out the street lights for sleep. That is the only reason that I did not rate sleep quality as excellent. Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel. It may be located off of Michigan Avenue, but the staff makes up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, very close to downtown Chicago, and a short walk to a Blue Line L station. The staff were very friendly, the room was clean and had coffee facilities (no fridge), there was a minimal breakfast (just enough to get one started for the day, until about 10!) and free wireless internet. Overall, it was what I expected, and it was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Blake left us hanging in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie_Ervin
Reviews.Content: Especially in an older building, cleanliness is important. Dusty lampshades, sticky floors and concierge countertop added to my dismal view of the hotel. Add to this the lack of a washcloth and a view of a sheer brick wall (all back side rooms) really dumbfounded me. When I called to get a washcloth, the staff stated that they didn't think that they had any. They said that they could bring me a hand towel instead, but when they never came, I helped myself from the open housekeeping closet. In addition to this, the room was extremely cold. We were told that the best we could to remedy this was to turn the A/C off, since heat is not possible at this time of year. We did this, but it still was not enough. We then had to open the windows and turn on the hairdryer and iron to warm up the room. Pathetic. The breakfast was coffee and 3 types of muffins. Oh yeah, and some oranges and apples. No juices, toast, bananas or cereal. I was not impressed. To be fair, the breakfast room is a bar, transformed by the very open windows and facing the sun. It was an excellent transformation of the room. Another bright spot was the bell hop "Showtime". The brother was colorful, witty, and showed us where to park with 24 hour manned security for the same price as unmanned.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was average but staff was great”
Reviews.Author: radiospike
Reviews.Content: On a busy weekend (Lollapalooza Festival) where most downtown Chicago hotels were full, we were lucky to find a room at this hotel which also happened to be extremely close to the festival entrance. We usually stay at the Hard Rock Hotel or the Intercontinental. The Wyndham Blake was nice, our room was recently updated and very clean. My two complaints: 1. Our room was extremely humid. Something was clearly wrong with the A/C system because the room was cool but extremely humid the entire length of our stay. We never informed the staff about it because we would return so late at night. 2. The "continental breakfast" was small muffins and coffee. That was it. But the highlight was outstanding customer service. Check in was a breeze and we were given a room upon early arrival. Day and night, the staff was helpful. And the Director of Rooms named Iris went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. She heard us say in passing that we were so tired that we didn't even have the energy to go out for a beer. When we got to our room, there were four beers waiting in an ice bucket for us. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless & Classic for the traveller interested in seeing the sights!”
Reviews.Author: GMACSAYSSO
Reviews.Content: The desk staff & concierge were always cheerfully helpful and the place was spotless! A classic ambience, with a luxury feel and just the necessities for a great stay, particularly the best beds ever!! Perfect distance for even a couch potato to have walked everywhere for 3 days straight to see EVERYTHING! When legs got tired, the public transit was very easy to use. Parking the car for 4 days seemed a little expensive, but came as no surprise as they post it on their site. Buddy Guy even popped into Legends while we were there and it was just a couple of blocks to walk home. (good thing) Felt very safe. Highly recommended if your intent is primarily to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: phoebe1419
Reviews.Content: Firstly, if you are going to stay here book directly through the hotel. They stupidly only sell king size beds to the travel companies (expedia etc) no matter how many people you said are staying in a room. Therefore, we had 4 ppl and one king size bed. The bed was not big enough for all of us. We had two men: one over 6'7 and the other 6'3 and two females. Since the hotel was booked completely & we had a wedding we had no choice but to take the room. The staff was quite rude and unsympathetic about the whole situation. They were unable to give us another room or fix our situation. However, The room was clean, well made, and was overall nice. We would have appreciated it had we not had such a horrible mix up with the beds. However, do note it is on a busy street and it does get noisy at night. BUT ITS Chicago. When we asked for blankets and pillows for the other half of our group not staying on the bed the staff put up a horrible fuss stating they should be in our room. The staff was extremely rude and made us feel like we were very unwelcome. However, we did not have blankets & we needed it to sleep. They finally brought us very a scratchy blanket and pillows with black make up on it. Frustrated, we asked for another and they said they ran out and did not have any extra. As a hotel, I am surprised that they didn't. Which means- they probably do not clean the blankets on the bed very often. The morning breakfast consisted of muffins and coffee. Not much of anything. We ended up drinking coffee and getting breakfast elsewhere. While the hotel is close to the sites, just beware of the scam through the travel sites. We probably would have had a nice stay had it not been for not having a bed to sleep on & no blankets. As well, we contacted the hotel management following our stay. They were of NO help. They simply offered us a "discount" if we stayed again. Not very likely, just goes to show you that they don't care much about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: MrDix2u
Reviews.Content: Family trip to see McCartney at Wrigley field. Great location - subway 1/2 a block away. Bit of a hike to Milleneum park and shopping, but not too bad if you like to walk. Hotel was clean, rooms well appointed - great showers. Only 'nits' were that there was a some mold on the bathroom calking and the air conditioning unit in our room was a bit noisy. The front desk staff were fantastic, very friendly and always greeted you warmly. The concierge service was also great, especially 'Showtime". He gave us a couple of great tips on where to eat and was very helpful throughout our stay. Parking is pricey at the hotel, there is a lot just around the corner that is about 1/2 the hotel rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RoverPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Loading and unloading the car was easy, the staff was friendly, our room was large and clean, and the bed was comfortable. The is free wireless with a reasonable speed. We were very pleased and would return afain

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: RKKJ
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for three days during a recent visit to Chicago. The room was spacious, quiet and clean. It was very comfortable for our family of four. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I chose this hotel based on the price, free WIFI and the free continental breakfast. The WIFI worked great in our room with good signal and fast internet service. The free breakfast was a little disappointing, but it gave us something to start our day, and it was free so that was good! There was always coffee but no free juice for the kids. The free breakfast consisted of muffins and fruit. There were more options available for a fee. We could walk to all the downtown attractions from this hotel. The valet parking was efficient and quick. A mini fridge would have been a welcome addition to this room. The only real issue we had was with our clock radio which I mentioned to the front desk the first day and it never got fixed or replaced during our stay. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to have. I would definitely stay here again and have no problem recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value but pathetic breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: Yelbid
Reviews.Content: The appearance of the hotel upon arrival was not as good as it looked on the website. We were led to room 101 which was neither on the first floor nor the second and involved taking an elevator to second floor and steps down to the room (we had several suitcases so this was not convenient). Once there, however, room was large, clean and well appointed. It was also incredibly quiet (caveat: there were 11 dumpsters outside and below the window not emptied by a beeping truck while we were there). Bathroom amenities also complete but the shower curtain gave us the choice of soaking the floor or having it constantly blow in on me as i showered. It was too light. Location was pretty good but it was mile from the main shopping area. we like to walk so it wasn't a problem. Adler Planetarium, Grant Park, Art Museum, south side of Michigan Ave were all easily accessed. We would stay there again if looking for a reasonably priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but limited amenities”
Reviews.Author: WGJ49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Blake Chicago on a business trip. The room was great and the staff very friendly. However, the continental breakfast was limited to muffins, bananas, coffee and orange juice. It is served in the restaurant, so you could order a full breakfast. A little wider selection would have been nice. Still, the room was great so this is just a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourism purposes”
Reviews.Author: rodrigoac
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in Chicago for location and good recommendations I read in tripadvisor. It is close to several attractions like museums, aquarium, planetarium, willis tower and great parks where you can go walking. It is a little far away from downtown and mag mile, 25 minutes walking, so if you want to go to Chicago for shopping only, better choice another hotel near to the river, a better area but also an expensive one. The only bad thing I could found was the breakfast. It is clear that most of hotels in Chicago do not provide breakfast, so it is a luxury to have it. But it is really really light: a coffee, a muffin and an apple, that's all. It is fine but a little bit shocking at the first morning. The good thing is a starbucks in front! The hotel is quite, rooms are wide, beds are incredible, lot of pillows to choose. The bathroom is a kind of neo-modern style, so no tube or anything that get the water from the shower inside. So after the shower the whole bathroom is a pool. That is not nice at all but at noon the bathroom is a bathroom again thanks to housemaid. I got a nice time in this hotel, the city is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “fine”
Reviews.Author: chienandalou
Reviews.Content: They had had a little fire just before we got there, so they sent us to another hotel for the first night, but they picked up the tab and it was a better hotel, so one can't complain. Once we got there -- there was a little construction noise, but they did a pretty good job. Well located. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff are great”
Reviews.Author: eugenekiowa
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is a gem in the city of Chicago. Stay here if you can the service is great, the location is great, the rates are fair and a parking ramp is a couple of blocks away with a quick shop a half a block away. If possible get one of the corner rooms. EK

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Tiers
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was pleasant and check-in was fast and simple. This is a very nice hotel for the money. The location is very convenient to travel around the Chicago area and it is within walking distance to Grant Park. We stayed in a Premium King and the room seemed bigger than some of the suites weâ€™ve stayed in. We did the â€œPark and Playâ€� package which is extremely nice being able to do the in and out with the valet with no additional cost. Overall I would definitely stay here again when Iâ€™m in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhctraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at the Wyndham Blake hotel. The common areas are uninspiring but the rooms are very large and nice. There are many drawers for storage in the rooms and in the bathrooms. My bathroom was also larger than an average hotel bathroom and and nicely decorated. The view out the window was a brick wall but I didn't get the room for the view. I wish I had tried the breakfast but I didn't. I had to get to work too early. The breakfast opens about 7 am. There is a restaurant that is attached and next door. It is pricey and not a place for a quick dinner on a business trip. It is more of a date-night-out restaurant. The door man, and the rest of the staff, were very helpful. Overall, I liked the hotel and would recommend it to others if you need to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, even Better Location”
Reviews.Author: jstritz
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful, our check-in was swift, staff let us leave the car out front for a few minutes, and told us of a couple safe lots for parking as alternative to more pricey hotel/valet parking. Getting to the room was a bit tricky, as we were on the 8th floor, a non-existent elevator button, with a half-floor walkup from 7th floor--just a little odd, kind of a Being John Malkovich kind of quirk. The room, two queen doubles, was flawless. Bathroom with fun, glass-walled walk-in shower reminiscent of European hotels but with a large double-sink and perfectly clean. Super comfortable bed, lots of extra pillows. 4 stars not 5 only because the restaurant is oddly situated down a hall, through two sets of double doors....and an order for wheat-toast took 25 minutes to bring, with no explanation or apology--that seemed a bit long! We stayed for a graduation weekend in mid-May, and the staff were especially helpful above-and-beyond in helping to carry in several large boxes and later help my graduate son take them to the local FedEx office for shipping. The best part is a great location, easy to walk over to the parks of Michgan Ave, or up past the library for shopping etc. Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sarakuday
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, the subway was really close by. The rooms were large but the space lacked furniture. There was free internet, and complimentary breakfast. I would have to say that was my only critique. If you wanna call a muffin, coffee and banana a breakfast then you will be happy. I was not impressed! Overrall If you dont care for breakfast and want a close location to the subway, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrwankel
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights there recently on vacation. It's a good value. Clean, convenient and a friendly helpful staff left a positive impression. We would gladly return. The(free)continental breakfast could use some improvement, but the Blake overall takes good care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Said I Would Stay Here Again and I Did!”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Blake, and this time we were upgraded to a Premium King room. All I can say is wow! The room was spacious (especially for a large city) and nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable, and it was great to have two sinks in the bathroom. This hotel is clean and quiet with a friendly staff. The only thing that would have made the stay better is valet parking at less than $44 per night. But it is Chicago, after all. Will definitely check out the Blake again next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A little hiccup, but they took care of it right away”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a very convenient location in Printer's Row, just about a 10 - 15 minute walk from Michigan Avenue and the Art Institute. Nice rooms and friendly, capable staff. We had a slight problem with our room - after showers, there was a strong sewage smell - the front desk took care of it immediately and moved us to another room - providing a free upgrade and even complimentary drinks at the bar that night. The hotel is undergoing some construction, which may have been the cause of our issue, but otherwise, you wouldn't know they were working - we never heard a thing coming from the construction area. The breakfast, as others have mentioned, is not great, but enough to get you going til you can get over to the nearby Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts. I would definitely stay in the Blake again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiiet but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: reynolk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed and Wyndham Blake, and we found it to be a very decent hotel. The staff was extremely friendly (especially Showtime) but the room itself was below average. The vents in the room had lots of dust, and the bathroom shower had mold in it. The location is great and is in walking distance to Michigan Ave and that famous Garrets popcorn. If travelling by car, self park for 25.00, as opposed to valet parking for 44.00. I would probably stay here again if the shower were cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed as a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: bduggan52
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and comfortable room. Internet access is essential for me , so when i ran into a glitch (twice!), I got immediate assistance in fixing my "operator error" problem.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Wyndham Blake was absolutely phenomenal due to its great staff, accomodations, and location!”
Reviews.Author: kallen24
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Blake while attending a conference. After arriving several hours before my scheduled check-in time, the staff offered to store my luggage while I ate lunch and checked me into my room early at no additional cost. My room and bathroom were spacious, pristine, and comfortable--just how I like my surroundings to be. I usually have trouble falling asleep in new places, especially hotels; however, I felt right at home in the bed and feel asleep with ease. And to top things off, I felt like all the staff exhibited excellent customer service and made every effort to insure that I was well taken care of. Overall, I felt like I got a bargain considering the accomodations and service I received. The next time I am in Chicago I will definitely be staying at the Blake again and recommend it to anyone who values a high quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “clean and classy”
Reviews.Author: graceandeli
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here when we came downtown for the Art Institute's "Art in the Dark" event. Welcoming staff, clean room, huge open windows, gigantic bed and artistic interior decorating. We would stay here again in a heartbeat except there's so many other hotels of the same quality we want to explore in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Hobbits
Reviews.Content: This is has been our annual trek to Lollapolozza for the past several years. Located only 4 blocks from the main gate, the hotel is simply a great place to stay with the perfect location. The staff is always accommodating, the rooms are spacious, clean, and modern. The hotel also offers generous discounts for booking early and our room was ready despite arriving earlier then the listed check-in time. We love it there and look forward to returning in August 2011. PROs: Good rates, clean rooms, modern, accommodating to guests, located blocks from Grant's Park, main bus routes at the hotel entrance and subway connection 1 block east. CONs: There is no parking so the closest garage (1/2 block south) is a rip off - DO NOT PARK there (City Garage or something like that). Two years in a row I parked there and was ripped off both times. Find another place to garage your car (Blake's staff is always willing to help).

Reviews.Title: “Great value â€“ friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi095
Reviews.Content: The Blake has become my first choice of hotel when I visit Chicago. It's ideally positioned with all train lines within a short walking distance â€“ including the Blue Line from O'hare. Plus there's a good selection of restaurants nearby. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. They're about to be refurbished, so will be even better then. Wireless internet is free. The Blake has been taken over by the Wyndham group since my previous visit, but it's retained its small boutique feel and its very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God it didn't change”
Reviews.Author: Miketravels_21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times before so I was nervous when I heard it was changed to Wyndham. Donâ€™t misunderstand I donâ€™t have anything against them, it just that the Blake was a boutique hotel. The rooms are nice and have a very personal feel. I was worried that they would be forced in to the Mega hotel mold, it would lose it charm or at least the prices would skyrocket. Price is only one of the factors when I travel and itâ€™s not even number one on the list. I was very happy to be greeted as a returning guest and the hotel has the same feel and personnel, from the bell cap to the front desk, had all the same smiling faces. They have moved the Continental breakfast to the onsite restaurant, which was a delightful experience. Iâ€™m happy to say I will be returning whenever I travel to Chicago. Add on the benefits of Wyndam Rewards and this is a Win Win opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good value for a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marybear44881
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and the employees were very courteous. Location was a little more south than would have liked but still an easy walking distance to Michigan Ave. A good value for a great hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Even Greater Staff”
Reviews.Author: folasadefatima
Reviews.Content: First, the location is wonderful, easy access from both Midway and O'hare. Very close to Michigan Ave and other attractions. The staff was very accomodating and always willing to help. I checked in very early that day, before 9am, which usually causes an early check in fee, but the front desk attendant waived it for me! The room was perfectly clean and welcoming. Each room comes with two complimentary bottles of water on your arrival day, which was a nice addition after a red eye flight and long train ride. The Wyndham Blake also offers a complimentary continental breakfast. This service was quite surprising since it is uncommon for a hotel of this caliber to offer it. The concierge was very attentive, always suggesting attractions to visit. I was greeted warmly every time I left or arrived the hotel. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: cabtennis
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful, bellman was very helpful, breakfast and drink tickets included with room. Convient location for us. Only negative was towels could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location ... but with a few annoying issues”
Reviews.Author: gbmom_11
Reviews.Content: The price of the room at the Wyndham is the main reason we chose this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised with the helpfulness of the porter. He was very friendly and suggested a couple of local restaurants which turned out to be real winners. The beds were very comfortable and the location was ideal for travel on the "L". On the downside .... we were placed in a handicapped room without being asked if it was okay with us. As a result, we did not experience the fabulous bathroom described by many of the other guests. Upon taking a shower, the entire floor of the bathroom was covered with water which drained in the middle of the floor. The sink vanity was very small and the toilet paper holder was falling off the wall. The bathroom seemed to require some serious cleaning and maintenance ... really a disappointment. In addition ... our entire floor had a very curious "wet" smell which was even worse in our room. In retrospect, we should have requested another room. On the flip side, friends of ours stayed on another floor which smelled clean and their room was very nice. We will stay here again but will be sure to request a non-handicap accessible room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and bathroom, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Acker004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blake Hotel 1/18/2011-1/19/2011 and got a double queen room. The design of the hotel was amazing and I fell in love with the look and colors. The room was very comfy and quiet. The bathroom is what sold me and is part of the reason I will be re-booking with this hotel in 2 weeks! Double sinks, lots of space and a large walk-in shower with a rain showerhead! It was very relaxing before a big interview. The service was friendly and helped us out a lot. The beds were large and comfy, though slightly firm for my tastes. Everything was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Luciana-Austin
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at this hotel through Priceline for a 3 night stay over New Year's Eve. We got an amazing rate (50% less than advertised on their website) and the hotel didn't disappoint. It's a decent location, the rooms are quite big and look new, nicely decorated, huge bathrooms with double sinks, there's a complimentary light breakfast at the lobby every morning (pastries, coffee and juice) and free wi-fi. Parking is expensive but around the corner there's a public parking that charges $17 for 12 hours and that's what we used. Staff was very friendly and recommended kid-friendly places for us to eat and gave plenty of discount coupons to city attractions. The only complaints we had were the strange hallways where you have to go down a few steps even after getting out of the elevator (not nice when you have a sleeping kid in the stroller) and the hallways smelled of smoke (the rooms didn't though, which was a relief). There were noisy guests slamming doors the night before and NYE, which was unfortunate. We were pleased with our stay and would consider staying here again, although my first choice is usually to stay on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for one night to pick up our daughter for winter break. This hotel was recommended by her apartment management. We got an amazing $99 per night rate, which included two drinks at the bar, free breakfast and $24 valet parking. As others have stated, the big negative to this hotel is the lack of drive-up access while checking in. It is tricky to find a place to park on the street in front of the hotel when you arrive. Grab the first place you see! The room was spacious for a large city hotel, and the furniture was very comfortable. The bathroom was also quite nice. The internet worked well, and the hotel was quiet. The breakfast in the morning consisted of hot tea/coffee, donuts, granola bars and fruit, as well as some juice. We did use the fitness center, and it was nice by hotel standards. It has windows on two sides, multiple pieces of equipment, some free weights and yoga mats. A t.v. is available while you work out as well as water. Open 24 hours with a room key. I will definitely try to book us at this hotel when we go back to Chicago in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GirlfromKtown
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time at Blake. We had a gorgeous room with huge ceilings, large bathroom and great service. We booked the room for $89, a great price for the location. Wifi in the room is so slow it's almost not worth it though.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected , not recamended for handicapp persons”
Reviews.Author: clovereyes
Reviews.Content: hotel was nice what i could see of it,not accessable for handicapp, had to stop traffic ,very dangerous situation to get into vehical, no parking , and valet is ery expencive , 44.00 per night , handicapp room was not street leval as was told , no bench in shower, and no recliner , as were made arangements in reservations, no wheel chair access to resturant, and fast food only around the hotel, shower had mold on floor and up the wall, water in room 4.00 per bottle, valet is the best thing about the hotel was very helpful and freindly, quick to our needs on arriving and leaving, dont think you may be able to check in a bit early ither, as its 3p and they dont waver from it,

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - but prepare to pay for parking!”
Reviews.Author: shannalee88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia so we were able to stay there when it would normally not be in our budget. Unfortunately, due to it's downtown location, parking was a large additional cost. They offered valet service for $44/night or self-park for $25/night. So when booking this hotel - keep that mind. The parking is the only negative thing I can say about this hotel though. It was wonderful! Nice, clean, pretty, and the bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! I hope that if I ever go back to Chicago I can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great for price but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: tmjones77
Reviews.Content: One old computer for public use is a sad "business center" TV in room was not flat screen and rolled out of cabinet so you'd bump into it if you walked past your bed. Besides we had to smack it to get rid of the lines in picture. Mold in my shower and a burnt out light bulb in the bathroom. Front desk staff didn't give my friends any info when they checked in - just here's your key, also couldn't tell them which metro station would be closest. Saturday morning I heard a guest ask where the nearest catholic church was and was told "I don't know" What is a concierge for? The cleaning staff & handymen were wonderful, but the uniformed staff didn't impress. Seemed to be trying to point out how much they were giving you for free. Early check in fee waived I was told 4 times. The breakfast donuts were fine for what they are, but we much prefered breakfast, lunch or dinner next door at PotBelly's. Also when we had Chinese delivered, the lobby/bar staff told me they had no plastic silverware, so I got some at Potbelly's. Next morning at breakfast they had plastic utensils out?? The bed was pillowtop like mine at home, we slept great. 300 threat count sheets is below what I use at home.. street noise wasn't too bad even on the 3rd floor. Location is just at the edge of everything. Walking distance from Union Station, Sears Tower, the Theatres and shopping. I am not unhappy, but didn't find the hotel met the 4 1/2 star rating. I've stayed in 5 star hotels and there is more than 1/2 star gap between them & Hotel Blake! For $109/night on New Years Eve, I think we got our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Large Room, very clean, & very friendly”
Reviews.Author: gac1408
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just perfect for what we wanted.....close to everything, very clean, large room and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay at Hotel Blake every time I visit Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ChristianaB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I planned this trip after months and months of research to find the perfect hotel. No matter how many options we gave ourselves, we kept ending up at Hotel Blake as our best option. I am SO glad we decided to stay there! The staff was more than accommodating and genuinely nice, the location was super quiet yet still had a great, central location with lots of shops, and the hotel room itself was considerably large in size and so so clean & cozy. Public transportation is no more than a block away and it was always easy to hail a cab right outside the hotel, if need be. I will forever be a Hotel Blake devotee while visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique just outside the loop that can make for an affordable stay in the windy city.”
Reviews.Author: bdobis12
Reviews.Content: This is simply a very solid hotel option in Chicago. The rooms are huge, the bathrooms high end, and the lobby is upscale. Parking is high at $44 per day but we got a room at just $99 a night over thanksgiving. The staff was helpful and even held our bags the day we departed.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely professional staff makes the place”
Reviews.Author: wangfei
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a very nice little boutique hotel -- not terribly fancy, but convenient and well put together. By all means consult other reviews for opinions on rooms, etc., but for me what puts this hotel above the average is the competence, friendliness and professionalism of its staff. It is already noticeable in ordinary interactions (and in small but appreciated amenities, such as free printing in the business center.) But the housekeeping and managerial staff at the Blake really saved my skin when I left an important item behind at check-out. One expects (or hopes for) some help in such instances, but they really came through at once. I am impressed and grateful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: maiagrey
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient. We arrived at the LaSalle station and walked a couple of blocks to this hotel. The blue line is also around the corner. I liked HB's uniqeness. I did not feel like I just walked into a mega-hotel and I also did not feel like I just walked into a franchised location. It was just right. Our room looked very similar to what they advertised on their webpage. It was nice and clean. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. Hot water was readily available. We were on the 5th floor. We could hear outside noise: traffice, ambulances, etc. It wasn't a big deal to me because once I layed down, I fell asleep fast. I also liked the free Wi-fi which worked the entire time. We only had interactions with staff when we arrived (front desk clerk) and when we left. Both encounters were very friendly and helpful. My husband and I were very satisfied with HB and will be coming back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great time , nice room and freindly people”
Reviews.Author: jcole9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Blake is a great place to stay and go to a Bears game. Clean and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, awesome service.”
Reviews.Author: Chefkeith80
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for one night on our honeymoon and when the concierge noticed we had the priceline room, he upgraded us to a suite! It was a really nice gesture and the room was beautiful. I didn't see the $99 rooms, but I can imagine that they are very clean and modern if they are anything like the condition of the suite was. I will definitely stay at this hotel again, even if the $99 rooms are small; you're in the Loop, who spends time in the room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ireland34
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel Blake. The staff members were very nice and helpful. The location was perfect -- easy access to the El, bus and Union Station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: msmarch70
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay at this hotel.It was very cozy,modern,up to date,clean,everything within your reach,with internet access,a restaurent,a fitness room,and more.The breakfast was also complimentary,.I'm looking forwarded to staying here again.I give it 5 stars.I have already recommened this hotel to my sister, and will to others.I'm not sure of the date i will return,but hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms let you relax”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the hotel. I would stay there again. Heat and cooling in the rooms are quickly reactive, which was helpful with the falling temperatures outside. Rooms are very posh and clean. I was on the 4th floor and easily heard traffic outside, but....that is the city for you. You can try and ask for a higher floor. Very close to restaurants and fast-food. I did not use the exercise room this time, but last time, no other guests were in there, and equipment was modern, clean, and in good working order. Don't rely on their "continental breakfast." It is scrawny and consists of cheap carbs (apples and oranges, coffee, pastries, no proteins or anything hot). Staff is extraordinarily courteous, warm, and professional. Within two blocks to metro.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great feel & location”
Reviews.Author: las631
Reviews.Content: Located at the south end of the loop, 2 blocks from the subway/elevated trains, this was a fun and convenient location. Beautiful room, no full mirror was annoying for getting dressed. staff was very nice but not knowledgeable about the subway system! Continental breakfast was lousy but the bar at happy hour was terrific (good wine and popcorn). I'd happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A rare gem in the South Loop!”
Reviews.Author: CatalexIllinois
Reviews.Content: I am a university professor in the South Loop area. I had a professor from London, England coming in to visit. I asked around hte university and someone recommended the Hotel Blake. I booked our stay. I admit that I had reservations without visiting the hotel first. This hotel is a gem in the South Loop. It exceeded my high expectations. My London guest was equally impressed too. The rooms are spacious, clean, and superbly furnished. They even offer a delicious breakfast in the morning. There is free Internet use at a computer on the first floor. I have already spread the word about this hotel to my colleagues. I will definitely stay again.
