In fact, I am booking it again later this month. Check it out - you will be delighted. DG

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: liveforsun99
Reviews.Content: The price was cheap and the train was close, the park is close, the breakfast was bad. If you are staying because the have free breakfast, don't stay. But over all everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and it's location”
Reviews.Author: Margaret167
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and it's location. Rooms were clean, large and very comfortable. Staff treated us very well and were extremely helpful when needed. The only small complaint I have is having to pay $4.00 for bottled water left beside the ice bucket each morning. Perhaps I missed it but I wasn't aware of the charge .Think it should be complimentary since the room rates are high enough to cover a few bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & staff very nice”
Reviews.Author: collegeparent1
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay here and have told all of our friends about it. 4 different families have stayed there and had the same result, GREAT! Mr. Bruno does an outstanding job with this hotel. It's close to just about everything. When staying in Chicago and you dont want to pay high $$$, Hotel Blake is the place. Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake, Great hotel , great location, fabulous staff, ***** 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: wofatrja
Reviews.Content: hotel Blake was recomended by local buisness as a great "Boutique" hotel, We found the staff very helpfull & friendly, Great location in printers row, Just blocks from Millenioum Park , waterfront, & Magnificant Mile. We will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a way to relax!”
Reviews.Author: pattysetter
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable at the Hotel Blake and we really had a chance to relx. Loved the view, the personell were very friendly and helpful.....we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Sleep Ever!”
Reviews.Author: bmeade13
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Thursday and stayed overnight at Hotel Blake. The bed was so comfortable I fell asleep at 3 p.m. and awoke from a peaceful, undistrubed sleep at 6 a.m. The room was spaceous, the bathroom huge, and the shower had a rain shower head I just loved! It's in a great location - near the blue line to O'Hare and several blocks from Michigan Ave. I was upgraded for free and given a discount because the orginal room's carpets were being steam cleaned. The only down-side I think was that the room was very cool, but I'm a woman so I tend to like my rooms on the warmer side.

Reviews.Title: “Columbia College Parents - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SCSWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: While our son was "shopping" colleges and subsequently chose Columbia College, we stayed at the Blake and other local hotels. The Blake is far superior (and closer) than the other hotels we stayed at in the neighborhood. When we moved him to Chicago to attend school we booked the hotel as well. It was a very emotional day and when we finally checked in about 6 pm we were told we were the "customer of the day" and had received a free upgrade and where handed two drink vouchers. We immediately went to the bar to redeem the drink vouchers. There we chatted with the nicest bartender (she is a senior at School of the Art Institute of Chicago) and she did everything to assure us that the location was safe, that our son would adjust quickly, that Chicago is an awesome place to live - she basically dispelled all our fears of leaving an 18 year old in Chicago as she was a transplant from Boston. Words we needed to hear. She also told us the hotel was dog friendly and we could bring our dog to visit our son next time. Then we went to the "upgraded" room and were "wowed and delighted" to find we were upgraded to a suite. If ever there was a day that we needed an uplifting experience it was the day we moved our only child 300 miles away to college in another state. The room was stunning. Upon check-out, we were told how to take advantage of exclusive offers/upgrades for future visits. We have four years of college to go and I see many stays at the Blake in our future - including the upcoming Parents Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: keithsias
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and convenient location make the Hotel Blake a great choice for my business travels to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Majovero
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was wonderful. The rooms were very elegant and serene. The hotel staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. I will be staying here again when I return to Chicago. The only gripe I had was with the valet parking service. BEWARE: The hotel is not affiliated with the valet company; they're a separate entity. There was a scratch on our rental car that they made. When I approached the hotel staff about it they graciously referred me to the owner of the garage who denied that his people had put the scratch there. If you have to use the valet, make sure that you walk around your car every time it comes and goes from/into valet. I spoke with the hotel director about this situation and I think he will be implementing some system to keep this from recurring in the future. Overall the hotel itself was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, will stay here often.”
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddy1766
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while getting our daughter settled for college. Our experience was wonderful. We prefer a quieter, off the busy streets type of hotel, without sacrificing room quality or amenities. Hotel Blake was perfect for us. The room was big, the bed very comfortable, the shower was tremendous, the people were very friendly. This is the hotel we will stay at each time we visit our daughter over the next four years.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: ATravelVixen
Reviews.Content: I just moved my daughter into college and first stayed in a different hotel. I was not happy so I searched for a downtown hotel close to Columbia College.The rate was great, the staff is the nicest I've come across. I got a great room on the 1oth floor. Big windows and a comfy bed, big marble bathroom. Good amenities, coffee maker in the room, good blow dryer not that cheap imitation stuff you usually find, complimentary continental breakfast and free internet. Newly remodeled, very tasteful and just all round a big hit. I will only go there when I come and it's only two blocks from Columbia, Moore, Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vshawlaw
Reviews.Content: This is great little hotel in a great location. Easy access via the Blue Line from Ohare, and easy access to other major CTA lines. Walking distance to major attractions and South Loop restaurants. The Blake is perfect for business travelers with business in the loop. I will definitely be staying at the Blake again.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 4-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Roadhog68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 5 nights. On 2 occasions we did not have hot water in the morning. There was mold in the shower. The continental breakfast was weak and they were regularly out of juice and fruits and when we asked for more, they simply replied that they were out. There were coffee grounds in the coffee. There was no refrigerator in the room and the ice bucket was a joke it was so small. Plastice cups in the room instead of glass. No on-demand movie option in the room. A 4-star hotel should not have these weaknesses.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a deal, not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: smackdown928
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for the hotel for our girls' weekend so jumped on it. There wasn't anything bad about the hotel, but not necessarily anything that stood out either. There was continental breakfast in the morning - fruit, pastries, juice and coffee but it could have been attended to a bit better (running out of certain items and taking a long time to replenish). The location is fine, close to a few metro stops and walkable to Grant Park but much of what we did took us further north and over the river so next time I'd probably try to find a hotel on the north side of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a deal - this is not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lashing
Reviews.Content: Other reviews cover things pretty well. Like most â€œboutiqueâ€� hotels they pretend to be something they are not and market to those who do not know the difference. You will see high prices on their website. Do not pay nice hotel rates for this place. You can and will get bargain rates via discount bid sites. For the price we paid â€“ isnâ€™t bad. But had I paid the rate on their website, I would have checked out immediately. Overall the hotel is OK but there is much missing in the details and a few very low points. First of all â€“ the shower had black mold in every corner and between many tiles. One corner was really bad. Youâ€™d have to be blind not to see this. I could even smell it. That is just inexcusable. Two, hot water is an issue in the mornings. They say its because everyone is using it. Well yeah â€“ youâ€™re a hotel and people tend to shower in the morning. No hot water. What is this? My grandmaâ€™s house with her 1940â€™s boiler built for two? Grandmas house is free. One of most peopleâ€™s positive points is one I cannot agree with and thatâ€™s Showtime. This guy is just plain annoying. He pretends to be your buddy but heâ€™s full of BS with his hand out. Cant walk by this guy without him trying for a tip. I call it a beggar â€“ others seem to find it entertaining. I preferred the other doormen. Which brings me to the hotels plus side; the staff were all nice to deal with. It appears this hotel has an array of room qualities so experiences differ. What I see is lots of missing details that make this a 2 start Supr * dressed up as a boutique hotel but with glaring faults such as bed skirt that doest fir the bed, chipboard closet door, mold in shower â€¦ itâ€™s not competition for the choices you have in the standard rates on their website. Not at all. If they cleaned up the mold and addressed the hot water I would up my rating. The mold thing is really disgusting though and you have to wonder how its possible to overlook this and what else is overlooked. Location is good. Lots in the immediate area. Staff overall were pleasant. Parking is overpriced but thatâ€™s Chicago. Showtime is just a beggar is disguise and he isnâ€™t fooling me. Seems to fool others â€“ he is missing half the time as he chases people down the street for tips. That folksy BS rap doesnt work on or for me. Other doormen were normal and helpful. Common areas quite nice. Actual room looked kind of like the pictures but not really.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MAW1050
Reviews.Content: Lovely remodeled rooms with TWO comfy lounge chairs. No flat-screen, but I'm sure that will come. Very friendly and helpful staff. Trendy, good restaurant. Reasonable prices and walk to Buddy Guy's and Jazz club. A little far from the North Circle action, but on a quiet street and easy access to the EL or busses. Large room. Twin sinks are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience”
Reviews.Author: AndresDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Blake in Chicago over a three-day stay. Blake is located nearby the Chicago Stock Exchange and the Public Library, a great location. Blakeâ€™s staff had for me a wonderful room with a clean and fresh bathroom. The Hotel is close to several metro stops and interesting pubs and restaurants. Blake is professionally staffed, and in particular, am grateful to Mr. Ian Hosack whose knowledge of downtown Chicago (and of Art), was quite helpful. I look forward to staying at Blake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: wndyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blake from 8-2-2010 through 8-5. It was my first trip to Chicago so I was pretty unsure about which area would be the best for all of the things that I wanted to do. I chose the Blake because it was sort of in the middle of everything I wanted to do. The rooms were clean (no cigarette smell anywhere) and the customer service was great. It is an easy train ride to/from the airport and a decent walk to the Navy Pier (we took a cab back). We took the train to Magnificent Mile and walked back, which was really an easy walk. There are gas stations near by, Panera, and a CVS. Breakfast consisted of fresh fruit and pastries which was perfect for us since we are not big breakfast eaters anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Welcoming & Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: maciemoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself just returned from a 4-night stay at Hotel Blake during our first visit to Chicago. We are seasoned travellers who have stayed in 4 and 5-star hotels throughout Europe, Canada the USA (among other locales) and we have high standards and expectations of our accommodations. Sometimes hotels that we have stayed at have fallen short of the mark, but this was not the case for the Hotel Blake. We were absolutely delighted with the hotel. Not only was the staff extremely pleasant and knowledgeable, but we found the hotel to be immaculate, tastefully appointed and well located relative to "must see" attractions and convenient transit services. We were assigned a corner Premium King room that was spacious, extremely clean and tastefully decorated. The large full height windows in our room also provided a wonderful view of the cityscape throughout the day and at night. We also tried a couple of wonderful local restaurants recommended by the hotel's Concierge, Maggie, who was both approachable and extremely knowledgeable about where to dine and what to see in Chicago. We would highly recommend this establishment to other travellers, especially those accustomed to higher-end hotels offering excellent service, tasteful accommodations and the more personal and intimate touchs associated with a boutique-style rather than large-scale hotel. In our opinion, the Hotel Blake has everything a seasoned traveller would want and, in fact, the hotel was more pleasing to stay at than some 5-star hotels that we have been guests of in the past. We plan to return to Chicago again and, when we do, we definitely plan to stay at the Hotel Blake and will recommend it to our friends and families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Would go back”
Reviews.Author: wweiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Blake in the winter time. Make sure you get a suite that overlooks the city. A little far away from downtown attractions but was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “From check in to check out -- great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Blake for the Cards/Cubs series. From the time we pulled up to the hotel until the time we left, the hotel staff was friendly, helpful and very accommodating. Greg was the best as he answered all of our questions and had great suggestions. Rooms were clean and comfortable - housekeeping did a great job. It's also a great location. We walked to the downtown area and were just a block or so away from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Modern Room in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Mueslix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of days during our trip. We found Hotel Blake to be a nice retreat in the city after a few days in the 'burbs. Friendly staff, modern amenities, charm, comfortable rooms, etc. Decent continental breakfast with choices of fruit, granola, pastries, and coffee. Coffee was also provided in the room. We really enjoyed the Fitness Center with large windows, tv, and several machines (two treadmills was helpful!) and free weights. Public transportation is so easy and close at this location that we didn't need a car - just google maps on our phones. Highly recommended, we would definitely stay here again. The price was terrific for the location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: M270
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights here on our first trip to Chicago and had a great time! The price was right for what we got and we had a very pleasant experience Pros: Convenient to several CTA bus and train lines, including lines to O'Hare and Midway. Great restaurant and the bar has half price wine bottles Mon-Thurs. VERY helpful staff. Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, CVS, 7-11 and ATMs are all within a block or two. Great pizza place across the street. Comfortable beds. Great location halfway between north and south tourist sights. Workout facility onsite. Cons: Not all rooms have a city view. No bureaus or fridges (at least not in our room). The business center only had one computer so it was hard to find a time to use it when no one else was. The continential breakfast was pitiful. The sheets were stained with what looked like grease when we first arrived but the housekeeping staff took care of the problem quickly and professionally. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely stay here again. It's in a great, safe location and the staff were all very helpful and friendly with suggestions of things to do and see. Our plane landed at Midway at 11:30 and we arrived at the Hotel by noon. They let us check in early so we didn't have to pull our luggage around the city for three hours, which was a huge relief. Thanks Hotel Blake, we had a wonderful trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Blake Made Good”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsandaconscience
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for a Hotel Blake room using 1800HOTELS back in November in anticipation of a U2 concert that night. The concert was postponed, but since I had the reservation, the wife and decided to see Blue Man Group instead and still use the room. The hang-up occurred when we tried to register - 1800HOTELS cancelled our reservation without notifying me. The Blake stepped up and gave us a room at a much lower rate, and also gave us free cocktails at the lobby bar for our troubles. Thanks! 1800HOTELS tried to screw us out of our money by making me wait for a resolution until I read online that they filed for bancruptcy. Thankfully, I used my credi card so the charges were reversed.

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: eman2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Blake for three weeks. The staff, from the Bellman to housekeeping are always friendly and helpful. Once, I thought I left an item and called the front desk. Ian was very attentive and after checking all sources could not find the item. I felt like a fool when I found the item at home and called Ian to thank him. The location of the Hotel is walking distance to everything downtown. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel as the room is very clean and neat, but the service is TREMENDOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake is the perfect stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorNYC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Blake continues to be my #1 hotel in a city full of mediocre hotels. Unlike some their counterparts Hotel Blake has large rooms that are well appointed and furnished. Large Desks with a setee and lounge chair, ottoman, and sitting bench. Lots of natural light from nearly floor to celiling windows. Baths are huge , marble, with dual sinks and Amazon Rain Forest-like shower. The beds are so comforatbale I never realize I have fallen asleep. The hotel is 2 blocks from Michigan Ave/Grant Park so its quiter then Loop or Mile locations. Cabs line up in front so no waiting , even on a rainy day. The subway Blue line at Congress is 1 block away and 2 blocks from the Red Line. Lots of closeby shops within 2 blocks for refreshments, sundries, or restaurants. The complimentary 2 drinks at lobby bar is a good start to the end of a long day. The staff actually cares if you enjoy yuor stay and go out of their way to try to meet every request. This hotel is the best value in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Travels6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Blake during week of the Memorial Day weekend. This review is a little late since I wanted to post pictures of our room, but I haven't got them back yet. We booked the hotel with Expedia so I was unable to do any of the hotel research that I normally do when searching for hotels - my mistake. We stayed on the second floor (right above the lobby area) so we got to hear a lot of the street noises. I've stayed in better rooms at lesser rated hotels. The "guest room" that they show on their website is no where near what we got. There was a hole in the wall under the desk area and electrical cords were exposed. The bedframe was nearly broken and the bed looked like it was precariously sitting in the frame. The cleaning service was sporadic at best - they did not always come to the room everyday. Aside from these cosmetic issues, my main complaint comes from the service we received. First big issue ... The bathtub did not drain well, so we were constantly standing in a pool of water when showering. Since this is unsanitary, I informed the young man at the front desk, Patrick, of our issue the very next day. He told me he would send someone to fix that. The next day the tub still pooled up, so we again informed Patrick that the problem was still happening. Again, he said someone would come to fix it. The following day, the water was STILL pooling. At this point, we would only be there one more day so we didn't see a point in telling him one more time when nothing was done about it for the first two complaints. Second big issue...On Saturday night of Memorial day there was loud music and bass that you could hear (or rather FEEL) through our floor and walls. At 11:00pm I asked the girl at the front desk what was going on. She informed me that there was a wedding in the hotel restuarant and that she "didn't think it would last for a few more hours." I told her that we had an early flight out, had to get up really early and asked if she could talk to whoever about the music. She said the hotel was not affiliated with its restaurant so she could not do anything but assured me that it shouldn't last more than a few hours. What???!!! What I find funny is that the management of this hotel has written replies to each of the negative reviews of this hotel. The management could learn some proactive management skills rather than reactive. I am hoping to get those pictures back soon so that I can upload what our room looked like to give a more accurate picture of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet in Downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Aagaard78
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is in a great location Downtown. You are not going to find a better value for your dollar. Parking at hotel is $44 overnight, but there is a $25 parking lot across the street. Nice little bar as well. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If I come to Chicago, this is the only hotel I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service, great room, fantastic bed & one of Time magazines places to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ukmoose74
Reviews.Content: I trawled for a long time on line to find a place in Chicago not knowing the area, there were a lot of positive reviews for the Hotel Blake and the free wifi was the final clincher for me. From the moment I checked in the experience the experience was fantastic. Ian & Katherine on the front desk did everything they could to make my stay as enjoyable as possible; recommending great places to eat as well as things to do. As a side note, the architecture boat tour they recommended was amazingly informative and a great way to see the city. The room itself was bright, airy, great big windows and a fantastic view of the Stock Exchange & the Sears (Willis) Tower & a great desk to take advantage of the free wifi (very reliable) to seek out more about the windy city, that's also how I found out Time magazine has this as one of it's top 5 places in the city. My few grips were the wedding guests on the Saturday night were a little noisy, but probably no worse than I've been after a wedding and the hotel bar is only open till 9pm but there's a couple of nice bars in the neighbourhood that more than made up for that. With all the main CTA lines nearby and great customer service it made my first trip to Chicago a very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Great Room. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: lcentola
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for business. Selected this hotel because it was close to my business. The staff was professional and accommodating. I ate at the restaurant downstairs. It too was excellent. The room was great. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great room - You will return to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eugenekiowa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Blake several times and it is one of the best Hotels and Staff in the world. Staff is always very helpful especially Michael and Juana. If possible get one of the corner rooms. They cost a little more but well woth the cost. Hotel has good location close but not to close to everything. Cannot say enough good things about this Hotel. Rooms are clean and decorated in a very refreashing manner. This is a Hotel you will add to your must return to list. Eugene Krueger

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elcid1
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room. The bathroom was great. The concierge "Showtime" was great, he was funny and had lot of good info about the city, especially about using public transportation instead of driving.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: hazelnutbrd
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at the Hotel Blake was just okay. Housekeeping did not show up until late afternoon usually. The hotel looked like it had been nicer in previous times (i.e. a plate in the bureau for a fridge/mini bar but no fridge at all) but had fallen downhill. One morning there was no hot water for over an hour - ridiculous for a hotel! Maintenance finally came and fixed it. If you're looking for luxury, this is not the place to go. Bed was comfortable and the room suited our needs for the moment.

Reviews.Title: “The Blake is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Horntraveler56
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel - it was everything we were told it would be and then some; wonderfully fun people, great service, excellent location, nice rooms and the value for the money is the best we've had staying in Chicago. We had a couple small problems and they were corrected immediately to our satisfaction. Overall we're VERY satisfied. Our only problem was that the standard rooms are placed in a location where you hear alot of noise - sirens were going off most of the night and they are VERY loud. But the beds were good and we slept pretty well. No hot tub or pool so its a good place especially for business and adults, and families with older kids who won't spend much time in the hotel. Not a place for families with small children looking to camp out. The only suggestion for improvement is that the breakfast eating area is too small to accommodate the bigger crowds (Sunday). The breakfast is average, but that they have it at all is a plus for sure. But they were not prepared for the big Sunday crowd and could not keep food and drinks replenished. That was a mess. But overall its a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “wow what a find”
Reviews.Author: Rick019
Reviews.Content: the hotel blake was great. it was one street away from the train. 2 streets away from grant park. great location. fantastic staff. Gregg "showtime" was amazing. He took care of our suit cases immediately. He even walked us to the subway and made sure we got on. WOW what service. I will definetely be back in CHI town and back to the Hotel Blake. Thanks so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Most awesome staff and Showers”
Reviews.Author: Jessie78660
Reviews.Content: I love this place. From the moment I called them after getting off the "orange" train, their staff told me which way to go to get to the hotel. I was greeted by beautiful and friendly staff everytime I walk in and out of the lobby. The room was awesome with a really cool walk in shower, it was about 7 feet with 4 feet of clear glass. Very nice. The hotel was only 3 blocks from Michigan avenue and Grant Park. You can pick up all the bus routes in 3 blocks..very cool. I would rate this place a 10..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice service”
Reviews.Author: adamss08
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over Memorial Day weekend for the Cubs/Cardinals game. It very easy to get to just about all the major landmarks in the city. My friends and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “promises unkept”
Reviews.Author: fossilizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Blake for 4 nights at the end of May 2010, and we left with mixed feelings. While the location is great if you want/need to be near the Loop (CTA close by, Blue Line perfect for airport transfer) and Grant Park (Buckingham Fountain), and the personnel we met was welcoming and friendly, the Hotel appears to â€œover-promoteâ€� its virtues. Our reservation confirmation clearly states â€œfloor-to-ceiling windowsâ€�, which our room had not. And while it might be true that some rooms offer â€œspectacular views of Chicagoâ€�, ours faced the windowless side wall of the neighboring at&t building. The â€œSavvy Shopper's Hotel Blake Guide to Chicago shopping complete with directions, shopping tips and an assortment of exclusive discount vouchersâ€œ we were promised in the confirmation never materialized. The â€œContinental Breakfastâ€� on the other hand was there, but we still wonder what continent they refer to. It was mediocre coffee, poor pastries and some fruit, put at disposal in the lobby, more or less in front of the counter. Complimentary minus the compliment. We will return to Chicago, but we wonâ€™t stay at the Blake again. When returning from our tour around Lake Michigan in early June we had another 4 night in Chicago, this time at the Belden-Stratford opposite Lincoln Park. Not as convenient a location, but a much nicer place that -in stark contrast to the Blake- keeps more promises than it makes (including a decent breakfast) for a lower rate! Chicago 2011 for us will be no Blake, more Belden-Stratford.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Loop”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before when it was the Hyatt Printer's Row and I'm glad to see that it has only gotten better with age. Hotel Blake has kept up with the times, but not forgetting it's rich history. Yes, it's far from perfect -- the breakfast is less than stellar and there are some things in the halls/rooms that could use some TLC, but for the most part, this is still an excellent place to rest after a fun day of Loop sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “I really want this to be my fav Chicago hotel but not yet...”
Reviews.Author: LoveFillies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to being a great boutique hotel, but on my visit it disappointed in a couple of key ways. I hope my experience is anomalous or readily addressed for future guests, because this could easily be your home away from home. We specifically selected and paid for an upgraded king room. Upon room arrival we did bring our initial concerns to the attention of a friendly front desk team. We were offered a much smaller room 2 floors up which wasn't an improvement although it did have our missing desk. We declined. When we asked what the difference was between the upgraded king and the cheaper, "regular" king room, we didn't get a clear answer. Out advice? Take your chances with the regular king and save your money :). PROS: -- Friendly and courteous staff -- Excellent location close to restaurants, bars, transportation and 10 minute cab ride to McCormick. Easy access to anywhere you want to go. -- Good value, surprisingly affordable rates. -- Very comfortable bed, including mattress, linens and pillows -- Truly adjustable, responsive air conditioning (not pre-set like many hotels where they let you think you are changing the thermostat but there is really a min/max effect.) -- Large room. Very nice to find in big cities like NYC and Chicago -- Waterfall shower head - nice modern shower (no tub and only slightly missed by me). -- Free wireless that works. Lots of hotels provide free internet but it never works due to bandwidth overload. Day or night, the internet a HB worked fine. -- Comfortable, intimate lobby vibe and decor, a simple and modern interpretation of the building's construction period? -- Small but suitable business center including a little conference room we found very helpful. Glass walls, nicely located right off the lobby. A real pleasure compared to some hotels who put the biz center it in a dark, windowless dungeon, as if always being away from home isn't punishment enough :). Thank you Hotel Blake! -- In room laptop safe. Surprisingly missing from many urban hotels. CONS: -- No desk. This was listed as a feature of our room type. Working without a desk for a long stay is tough. Probably the first hotel I've staying in in 10 years without a desk. -- DARK! Yes, hotel rooms are often dark, but this room set a new low. Couldn't wait to get out of the room and avoided it even when it would have been convenient to stay in. We asked for and were graciously provided with an additional lamp but it made no difference. Best description: similar to a household hallway at night, when lit by light filtering through an open door or a nightlight. Pretty dreary. -- No drawers. There was an armoire that housed a small TV but the space below, usually drawer space or mini bar, was just a big empty box and waste of space. Hard to keep clothes nice and ready for biz mtgs over 5 days/4 nights. Also hard to keep room tidy. -- Few power outlets. Only 2 in spite of rooms size unless you pulled out the armoire in order to plug in the iron. We asked for an extension cord with additional outlets which was provided cheerfully and immediately. This is a warm and friendly hotel. -- Poor initial towel and toiletry stocking. Upon arrival our room had no floor towel and just one hand towel. It did have 2 bath towels. Also, there was no soap for the shower. Unless my husband wanted to use shower gel, he had to remember to take the hand soap bar from sink to shower and back again. Our towels were restocked properly. -- No refresh of toiletries. With two in a room, toiletries go fast. In spite of leaving housekeeping a $5 daily tip, toiletries weren't refreshed (they may be today, we have one more night here). -- No down comforter cover. Although a sheet was placed above and below it, IMHO this is a sanitary issue. Covers move around during sleep and it was kind of icky to think that I was touching the comforter that touched previous guests. -- Upgrade didn't involve a higher floor. Our room was on the third floor. Perhaps my expectation was too high, but my experience of dozens of hotel nights per year is that upgraded rooms usually mean at least slightly higher floors because it reduces urban street noise. -- Don't get excited about the "floor to ceiling windows" advertised. Even in our upgraded room our view was a brick, virtually windowless building. Fully open curtains added no real light. -- Decor. Although it is somewhat like the picture, the differences are significant. No footstools for the nice armchairs (which made our work space alternative tough - footstools help hold a laptop comfortably on legs), less functional side tables and lighting. Also, though not important to us, there are metal cover plates on the walls...where we assume there was once sconce lighting and/or power outlets. Overall, It felt almost as if our room was the one in the hotel that wasn't quite finished when the hotel was refreshed...just the vibe, not a fact. -- "Free continental breakfast". Not for those who like to eat healthy while traveling, donuts and pastries, one fruit only (e.g. today there were apples). -- Not significant but annoying. One small waste bin...in bathroom only. Kind of strange to be given a large room without trash bin; if we weren't relatively tidy types would have made a lot more work for housekeeping. Hopefully you understand my dilemma. You probably won't miss if you are leisure traveling, or if you don't mind asking for things that should be there automatically, but for biz travelers who return after a tough day of meetings with a night's worth of work to be tackled, my experience says this isn't your hotel in spite of it's pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: jon4224
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip on a Tuesday morning at least a month before the travel date through orbitz online using the option to buy a package and "save" money. I purchased a king room for 3 days and paid more for the room. No more then 15 minutes later after booking I contacted orbitz realizing I needed to change plans. Usually this is no problem as you always get some kind of grace period. Orbitz personnel contacted the Blake Hotel and spoke to the manager on duty that told orbitz and, in turn me, that there was no way to change anything or cancel without losing all my money. Knowing that I would lose close to a thousand dollars for the flight and hotel I moved my plans to now coincide with my expensive mistake. I arrive at the hotel after a long flight and many delays due to weather in Chicago to find that the Blake Hotel had overbooked and already gave all king bed rooms away for the evening. The hotel that was completely inflexible after making reservations was now expecting me to be flexible. I was told they had nothing other than a smaller twin bed room. I thought this was unacceptable and that they should upgrade or refund my money, but I was told both options were impossible. I was left with no option but to take the room. I was told to ask at the front desk the next day and maybe something would become available. I explained that I did not want to go through the hassle of waiting around the next day hoping for a different room and then, if available, changing rooms when I am supposed to be celebrating my fiancÃ©eâ€™s birthday. If it had not been 11pm and my fiancÃ©eâ€™s birthday the next day I would have found another hotel. I received no compensation other than 2 drink tickets to a bar in the hotel that was already closed. In the past, I have stayed at this hotel many times, mainly because of the price, and have accepted the little problems/ inefficiencies that make it a 2 or 3 star hotel but this kind of treatment should never be acceptable to anyone who pays over 20 dollars for a room in any hotel. My advice, pay a little more for the Drake, the Knickerbocker, the Swissotel or any other hotel where the staff treats you like a human being and chooses to honor their rigid, totally inflexible booking policies that they expect you to abide by, instead of simply worrying about the bottom line.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but many operational issues”
Reviews.Author: kenny11lee
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and they missed my wake-up call on the first day causing me to skip breakfast and take a cab to my meeting. In my room, the TV remote's battery cover was missing so the batteries kept falling off so I had to hold them with my hands to use it. The privacy tag was also missing so had no way to keep the cleaning lady from waking me up. Being in Chicago and the price they are charging, you would think that a simple service like loaning umbrellas to their customer is a no brainer, but NO. They asked me to buy one from 7-11. Finally the room's sound proof was almost non-existence with the constant humming noice from other rooms' AC and plumbing.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: AlexisBY
Reviews.Content: I booked the room at Hotel Blake this past winter during a trip to Chicago, because it was recommended for a wedding I will be attending come this June. The staff members were all very helpful and gave us a complimentary upgrade as well as directed us to activities in the area. The hotel is clean, well managed and in the center of the city, within walking distance to lots of notable clubs, bars and restaurants. I plan on booking a room for the wedding and have already recommended it to several of my friends. Very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “There aren't enough stars.”
Reviews.Author: kestrachan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Blake for a week on vacation, and from the moment we got out of our car, the experience with Hotel Blake was all we had hoped and more. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the room could not have been more lovely or comfortable. In fact, it was such a wonderful home away from home that we would have been hard-pressed to ever leave the hotel except that the location was so central to everything that we wanted to do! There aren't enough stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean Hotel with spacious rooms and excellent hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: k9becvar
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the beautiful Hotel Blake!!! The service was excellent and my room was very clean and spacious. The beds were super comfortable!! The location made it easy to walk around downtown and enjoy the Chicago night life!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing an affordable and comfortable place to experience Chicago. I will definitely stay at Hotel Blake the next time I am in chicago!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, cordial staff, impeccably clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: rogue88
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is absolutely beautiful, from the lobby to the bathrooms. We were greeted warmly from the moment we got there, and the staff went out of their way to meet our every need. Our room was spotless, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was huge!! Our room was cleaned every day while we were gone, yet somehow we were never bothered while we were there. The continental breakfast is very charming too! There's a convenience store two buildings down and a starbucks right across the street. I love how the Blake feels tucked away but is really only minutes from all of the action. For such a high luxury feeling, it's surprising and wonderful that Hotel Blake won't break your bank!!

Reviews.Title: “Always A great Value At the Blake!”
Reviews.Author: mrhall77
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Blake and I was skeptical if it was going to be as good as the first stay. One word, BETTER! The staff is first rate, the doormen helpful as always, the rooms clean and comfortable. You cannot, i repeat cannot stay at a nicer, homier and friendly place than this. I love this hotel!! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Blake and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: america681
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short weekend trip where my kids and I were able to stay at the most wonderful hotel, Hotel Blake. The room was spacious, clean, and georgous. We loved the view of the surrounding city buildings, from our floor to ceiling windows on either side. We had the most wonderful nights sleep, due to the bedding being very comfortable. The bathroom was elegant, with twin sinks and a huge tub/shower. I can't wait to go back again, and this time stay longer. Since coming back home, I have told everyone I know about the best hotel I have ever stayed in.....Hotel Blake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with 5 Star Luxury Feel”
Reviews.Author: ethnicdiamond
Reviews.Content: I am an avid user of TripAdvisor and read and re-read the reviews given by people who stayed at Hotel Blake. Despite the negative comments, I went with the majority that said they had a lovely time and boy was I glad! My husband and I went on an impropmtu getaway just for the day at Hotel Blake. We booked a room and with valet parking it was a little less than $200 with tax!! The hotel is rather large but the lobby is quite small. That is totally made up for in the rooms. The king sized bed was ridiculously comfortable with amazing sheets and comforters. The bathroom was beyond amazing with a huge layout with space between the toilet and sinks and shower (which was amazing) and pulled together with a very elegant touch. The staff were very courteous and helpful when ordering room service (call down to the hotel restaurant for more options -yay!) and our overall checking in and checking out needs. The complimentary wifi and great location were just an added bonus to an already enjoyable stay. I definitely plan on going back to Hotel Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, overrated!!!”
Reviews.Author: dihagermad
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived, Mr. Personality greeted us and took our luggage with a tip for a short trip to the room which we could have done easily. Lobby very outdated. Desk clerks social. Decor not at all classy. Very outdated and dull. Rooms ok. Small but nice. Distance to shopping very far for walking. (about 20 blocks to the north district) Continental breakfast very disappointing. Very small with limited selections!!! Coffee,tea, fruit, muffins on certain days, is about it!!!! Would not stay here again. Nice, safe, cheap parking two blocks $23.00/per day vs. $44.00 with the hotel. We left car for three days and all was ok. Under a roof. Chicago has much better to offer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and restaurant/bar, with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: PapaPiranha
Reviews.Content: I liked this place much better than the Palmer House Hilton, where I was attending a conference. Free wifi, free drinks at the bar (where the bartenders and bar menu are great, not to mention the restaurant), and generally very friendly and comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Very Clean and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: IHCOhio
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the price for this hotel. It looked like a five star hotel for the price of a two star hotel. Rooms are spacious and very clean. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: wrgw69
Reviews.Content: The Blake is located just a few blocks south of the downtown Chicago theater district and across the street from the Chicago Library. It is very well run with very pleasant and accommodating staff and very well appointed rooms. The attached restaurant is EXCELLENT and really good for drinks before dinner. Watch for a deal - we got a great room, including valet parking, for only $89! Valet parking alone is usually $44.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay because the staff understand service and the location is PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: DHaygeman
Reviews.Content: I got to experience what I would call 'high performance coordination' on the part of all of the staff I had contact with: Michael at the front desk: an exemplar of the sort of understanding a Road Warrior would return for. Joe in Engineering: Extremely helpful on a vexing technical issue. Ron the Doorman: Actually loaned me his PERSONAL umbrella when I was running late to a meeting. 'Showtime' the doorman: Delightful and entertaining assistance to an acceptably decent lamb chop dinner. Possible improvement? Provide ultra pasturized half& half in rooms in addition to the packets of white powder in the coffee accessories. All in all, a delightful 3 day stay with a Starbucks right across the street! Dan H.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: tallyho67
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is a low key, hip hotel that offers a comfortable and large room for a reasonable price. We were placed in one of their best rooms when we asked for an upgrade...no problems. Try Custom House, the adjoining restaurant--one of the best meals I've had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all!”
Reviews.Author: sueshui
Reviews.Content: Besides the excellent location and extra ordinary neighborhood, the Hotel Blake treated us as if we were indeed special! We were upgraded to one of the rooms with the floor to ceiling windows, with a beautiful view of the city in the privacy of our room. We felt cared for from the minute we walked in the door. Since we had mentioned we were celebrating our Wedding Anniversary we were hoping to have a wonderful room, but never expected the front desk to upgrade us without even asking. That set the tone for the entire get-a-way weekend. The upgrade itself just made our celebration truly special and romantic. We are on a limited budget, and limited with time, due to taking care of an aging loved one, and had felt pampered, rested, and totally entertained, just by walking out our door. There is sooooooooooooooo much to see, and do without spending a fortune. Yet the richness of our experience began with our lovely stay at the Hotel Blake. We are planning a trip back in June 2010 for the Blues Festival, and want to invite our closest friends to join us. We hope you don't hesitate to consider the Hotel Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Great find inside the Loop”
Reviews.Author: stephbo93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Blake recently during our mini-honeymoon. The room was absolutely beautiful and luxuriously appointed, and the front desk staff was extremely helpful. The El is right down the street, so it was easy to access everything. The bed was extremely cozy. I have lots of difficulty sleeping, and it was absolutely no problem in this bed. The mattress and pillows were comfortable, and the linens were high quality.

Reviews.Title: “What Happened?!”
Reviews.Author: SabiIL
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this is my 3rd time staying in this hotel so ... you know I had to have booked it for some reason, right?! The 1st stay was in OCT 06, 2nd stay was in OCT 07 and then my most recent stay. I was SO excited when I found this wonderful deal through Southwest Airlines for this hotel as me and my fiance have enjoyed staying here in the past . The positives: the service of the hotel staff is still excellent. They are friendly, helpful and prompt with any request we had. Additionally, they have added a Continental breakfast in the lobby as part of your stay which was also a nice addition. And the location of the hotel to Grant Park, Michigan Avenue, Museum Campus can't be beat. The negatives: as soon as I walked into our room the first thing I saw above me was (picture #1) and with a quick glance around the room, the next thing I saw was (picture #2) and as I entered the bathroom I noticed the following (pictures #3-4). Now, I will say with the exception of the grate (pic#1) the room was clean overall. I don't know how much it costs to repair the things I have pointed out but I will say that had I paid the usual customary room rate (which we have done in the past and was very satisfied) and not gotten such a good deal with Southwest I would have been [--] as it was I was "okay" with it since the quality service was still the same and room was clean overall. I hope that somehow these needed repairs were an oversight and not the norm - it would be a shame if this hotel has fallen into disrepair overall. So while I would still recommend this hotel, I do so with a caveat ... only if you can get a deal for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: petermcdermott
Reviews.Content: We would like to recommend the Blake. Rooms very nice with neat view. Great location., nice employees

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: joylandMichigan
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Blake was excellent. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and large. The bathroom was large and the rainshower showerhead was a treat! The front desk, valet as well as the housekeeping staff were all very accomodating. The hotel's location is fabulous-close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Surprise”
Reviews.Author: James1811
Reviews.Content: Not having been to Chicago before, my wife had left me to sort out our travel arrangements so I plumped for the Hotel Blake and boy am I glad I did. we arrived very early off the train from DC but the receptionist couldn't have been more helpful, telling us we could have a room now, but if we were prepared to wait the room originally set aside for us was a corner room and one of the best in the hotel. So we waited and they stored our luggage for us and recommended somewhere good for breakfast and as the sun was shining we set off for Millennium Park and the Willis Tower and when we returned our room was ready and we were extremely pleased. It had everything we wanted and plenty of space too, The bathroom was huge and as big as some hotels rooms i've seen in Paris or NYC. The continental breakfast supplied in the lobby whilst basic was a nice touch and enabled you to start the day with a coffee and pastry. The concierge was helpful and recommended dinner options and was generally a chatty fellow. All in all it capped off a lovely stay in a city where we did not know what to expect. We'll definitely be back one day, just a shame it's such a long way away from us down here in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep, spacious room, nice shower”
Reviews.Author: zechster
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable bed. Friendly and helpful staff. Definitely clean. No waiting for hot water in the shower. Though the bathroom is definitely meant for taller people (I'm only 5 feet tall).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Deal in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rwpjr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Blake from a friend's recommendation. Glad I took the advice. The things that matter to me were all there - location, king-size bed, big room, fairly new renovations, free internet, free breakfast - at nearly half the price of the big chain hotels but with boutique hotel service and atmosphere. Front desk staff was great; were very helpful with several business related and transportation requests. THE BEST HOTEL DEAL IN CHICAGO!

Reviews.Title: “I want to love this hotel but can't”
Reviews.Author: drhowarddrfine
Reviews.Content: This is like the first class hotel that couldn't. While all the staff was very friendly and helpful, when I pulled to the front of the hotel in a snow storm, I expected someone to help unload my car, and not afterwards by the lone bellman. Our room was clean and comfortable though my wife complained a bit about street noise. The heat for the room ran and ran till we were sweating. Maintenance was called and he showed us the "trick" needed because the thermostat did not really match the heating system. Our preferred way was to just let it run till we were too warm, then turn it off. Then we couldn't get the TV to work which also required a call to maintenance for that "trick", too. Internet service is free but wasn't working when we arrived. We were told the service could bog down with heavy usage and we noticed that. We shared the same floor with housekeeping who shared all their gossip and daily coming and going outside our door, including yelling for each other down the halls. The location is perfect for us and eating/drinking are all right there or within a block or two but, with the rate jumping back up, it puts it in the realm of other hotels that do this better. This was our first stay due to a great winter rate. What's sad is the

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake - Outstanding room, service and a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bobmuellner
Reviews.Content: What a hotel treasure just south of the Loop. The rooms are well appointed and the staff is extremely friendly and courteous - so much so that I was upgraded to a suite that was large enough to have a 50-person party in. The restaurant was killer - I would eat there every night if I didn't have to meet business associates elsewhere. And the beer selection at the bar is one I have never seen - it is a beer connoisseur's dream. Next time you're in Chicago, make sure you stay at the Hotel Blake. Oh, and did I mention that it's a great value, too?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in South Loop”
Reviews.Author: TangWong4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Blake just south of Congress Parkway on Dearborn in Jan 2010, and can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for comfort and convenience. Rich wood-paneled lobby, front desk personnel consistently polite and helpful. Room on 8th floor was spacious and tastefully decorated; bed firm, not mushy; bathroom also spacious with walk-in shower, twin sinks. Business office for guest use, printer available. Short walk north to heart of loop district, CTA stations (Harrison, Library) nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stl211
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our visit! Great location and we got a great rate! Booked on their website and we got discounted valet service and complimentary drink coupons. The doorman was very knowledgeable and helpful. The room was very nice and spacious, nice view as well. The rooms were very quiet, I didn't know until we checked out that we had neighbors. The checkout wasn't that great because the valet service was very backed up. They only had one valet and there was a wedding party checking out. We waited close to an hour for our car. But I would stay there again... Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: AttyPatty
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a pretty nice place, until the itching started the day I left (stayed Thurs. through Saturday night at the end of May 2009 in a double room on the 10th floor). It got progressively worse for several days. I called the hotel to let them know, and after sitting on hold for several minutes, they asked if I went to the doctor (no, I didn't think medical attention was necessary or useful), and acted like they had no idea there were bugs. Maybe it was only our room that was infested, but it was like nothing I've ever experienced. My daughter showed up Friday night and never noticed anything. I don't have bugs at home and have never had them before or since.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with standard amenities”
Reviews.Author: HomeGrownGlobally
Reviews.Content: I am a chicago native and I picked this hotel because I wanted to suprise someone who was coming into town with a romantic weekend. It was a success. The beds are great, the showers are nice with full marble and have rain shower head, and the rooms are spacious (couch, arm chair, etc). I used the excercise room everyday I was there, which was good. The water machine was broken, but I reported it and the next morning they had a repair man there. It's hard for me to rate this place for location since I'm a local. I don't really care about being close to the magnificent mile or anything like that, but if you need to get to the tourist places a 5-10 minute cab ride will do it. My only complaint is the continental breakfast, but these are generally subpar and anti-climactic at most hotels in the states. All in all this is a really good hotel, but if you need a refridgerator or microwave, jacuzzi or a pool, and full spa facilities this is not the place for you. If you're looking for exceptional bedding (she couldn't stop talking about the bed), good customer service, and ease of movement to tourist destinations complete with a totally modern feel wrapped in a classic facade; then this would be a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: foodienv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for business travelers, I would probably stay for leisure as well because the service is so great. There is a computer and printer available 24-7 as well as free internet (as it should be everywhere!) and continental breakfast. The rooms are very pleasant; they are spacious and comfortable. I prefer the quiet location of this hotel compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Chicago (including the Hyatt convention center which is a difficult to navigate and wholly inconvenient monstrosity). The 24-hr fitness center was a big sell, and the in-room jacuzzi tubs in the suites (suites only) almost make up for the lack of a pool. The very best part about the hotel was the excellent service. The "bad"...had a minor billing issue that took a some time to correct (but was eventually corrected very cordially), they could serve better coffee for breakfast. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kschaf13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel when we went to the Cubs Convention. It was handy for the Convention, but is located quite a distance to anything else. There are subway stations within a few blocks that are convenient. Not many restaurants nearby. Very dark in the evening around the hotel. The showers are set up very poorly. A partial glass wall, no curtain. The water went all over the floor. Not a bad hotel for $89. If you are planning to be near the river or north, not a good choice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rome ITALY Malmo SWEDEN Michigan USA
Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel description was very misleading”
Reviews.Author: dawsonduck
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two nights at the Hotel Blake this winter, enticed by the great location, excellent price, catchy photos online and decent reviews. We were between a couple of different places, all 4-star hotels downtown running about the same price and we chose the Blake in the end because of the "complimentary breakfast" included in the price. Unfortunately, I am pained to even call what they offered that: there were 3 dry scones, a basket of close-to-rotten fruit and a coffee machine. There aren't even tables and chairs to sit at (just the 3 or 4 lounge couches) and the lack general layout of the breakfast table was reminiscent of what most hotels offer all day long - a decorative bowl of fruit and free coffee. I have stayed at HoJo's with better options. On the plus side the staff was extremely helpful and polite, the rooms were not quite what they seemed online (no comforters on the beds even - we had to call down for an extra blanket just to stay warm though they were really kind about bringing it up to us at 11 pm) and in general we didn't come to Chicago to hang out in our room so the location was a real perk. It's well connected to a number of CTA stops and just a few blocks from the Art Institute - it was a bit chilly in our room though after hoofing it in the snow all day and the heaters didn't work that well (they were blowing hot and then cold air all night). All in all, I would suggest staying at other 4-star hotels in the area before considering the Blake. The breakfast may be free but it's pretty much non-existent and we've stayed in much nicer hotels for more or less the same price. Cheers to the friendly staff and thumbs down to the owners for being so cheap with their advertised "free breakfast".

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake a great stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: TripvilleTripster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are no strangers to Chicago - we travel there frequently. We are also picky about our lodgings. On our most recent trip we stayed at the Hotel Blake (HB) for four (4) nights. In our previous travels we've stayed at some "supposed" higher end (priced) hotels and, while those hotels were nice, we found the HB to be a great deal. Our package included a reduced room rate, valet parking and 3-day CTA transit pass. Our first room on the third floor was a little noisy (it was near the street and stoplight) but the staff at the front quickly and without fuss moved us to a higher room. The rooms were spacious, clean and up-to-date. The continental breakfast, while not elaborate, was more than enough to satisfy our morning appetite and get us on our way. The HB is in a great downtown location within walking distance of some good restaurants, bars and CTA stops. The staff was friendly and helpful. We plan on staying at the HB again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MCal74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake was extremely convenient for my meeting at the FEMA Region V offices. My room was very spacious. It had a high ceiling and was clean and well provisioned. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very professional and customer-focused. It was a totally positive experience which exceeded my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised that they provided a complimentary quick breakfast, which was very helpful. I will definitely use the Blake again when in the area. For transportation from O'Hare, I scheduled Airport Express for pickup at O'Hare and Hotel Blake ($50 round trip).

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to the theater and decided to make a day and night of it in downtown Chicago. We were very pleased with our decision to make the Blake Hotel our place to stay during this visit. Maggie checked us in at the front desk and was very welcoming and helpful. We checked in a little early and were pleased that we were not forced to wait for our rooms. She was very helpful in helping us choose a restaurant and giving us ideas for activities in the city. The rooms were beautiful--they were all recently renovated and looked like an upscale boutique hotel. The beds were very comfortable and quality linens were used. The showers were spa-like and I like the large size of the bathrooms with the double sinks which make it easier for more than one person getting ready. We had dinner at the Custom House next door. The food was good and the service was excellent. Having a complimentary breakfast was a nice treat. Corey made sure that we had everything that we needed--very appreciated! We would definitely say at this hotel again and recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: messerNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very upscale and the service is excellent. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mildlycrazy
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Chicago as a surprise anniversary present the weekend before Thanksgiving. I am unfamiliar with Chicago, but knew I wanted to stay near the museum and Millenium Park. On a value travel website, I found a rate for Hotel Blake less than half their advertised rate and I was sold. Reviews said it was 3-4 stars, but I really wasn't sure what to expect. When we showed up, I was pleasantly surprised. It's in a good neighborhood, and only a few minutes walk from Michigan avenue. We checked in very late, but the desk staff was courteous and helpful, though we did have to unpack and carry our bags ourselves. Valet-parking was available from the hotel, but half price parking is available literally just down the street from the hotel. When we made it to our room on the 9th floor, I was amazed at the room. Large room, magnificent bed, good decorations, huge bathroom. There was no train or traffic noise on the 9th story, and we both got excellent sleep on the comfortable mattress. Free wifi, excellent soap, shampoo, body wash, etc... even a sewing kit. The room definitely deserved four stars, my only minor quibble was a little mold in the shower stall of an otherwise impeccable bathroom. We never really tried the TV, but the room clock connected to my ipod, which I thought was neat. The free breakfast was great and unexpected, but I recommend getting there early as they ran out of donuts and danishes well before the posted closing time. Service was uniformly cordial and helpful, recommending good restaurants and nearby attractions. (awesome, but get there early). The pictures of Chicago posted on the Hotel Blake website were not representative of the actual view from the hotel, but google maps let me know what to expect in the vicinity. Overall, I heartily recommend the Hotel Blake and will probably stay there again if I can get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Icon1SanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: When this hotel was booked for me I was somewhat skeptical as the price seemed to indicate a sub standard hotel but I thought it would be fine for one night. Boy was I surprised; this is a charming hotel with big rooms, very nicely designed and well appointed. My room had a spa like shower, a very good desk space to work at and free internet service. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Next door is a great restaurant the Custom House which I would recommend even if you were not staying at the hotel, so the fact that is right next door is a real bonus. This hotel will be on the top of my Chicago list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: SaintPaulMurph
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Blake for my recent visit to Chicago for a conference/vacation. The hotel was in a convenient location for the conference and super dining options (especially Tamarind). The hotel was superbly styled...fun and contemporary, rooms were very comfortable. Breakfast was simple but a wonderful start to the day. Staff was very pleasant and very helpful. Normally, I haven't traveled to Chicago much but having stayed at Hotel Blake I may make more impromtu trips to Chicago knowing I'll have a comfortable, fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: IndyFLA
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel Blake regularly for business, and it never disappoints. Clean, stylish, large rooms, nice bar, and attentive staff. My only complaint is the inconvenient ice machine location.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of bathroom space for girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: AK_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: I took an annual trip to meet a group of girlfriends in Chicago and we were happy to stay at the Hotel Blake. It's easy to get to by taxi, train, or walking around the loop. The room had modern furnishings, two very comfortable queen beds, and a large bathroom with two sinks and enough counter-space for all of our toiletries. The shower was a big walk-in shower with rain shower head. Our stay was very pleasant. The complimentary breakfast was sufficient for a free breakfast downtown, but on one of the mornings we got there just at the end of the session and everything was already cleaned up and gone. Internet was free with a code. Only small drawbacks of the room were no minifridge for refreshments, we had to walk up some stairs to get to our room, and one morning we didn't have enough towels. When we called the front desk we were informed that housekeeping wasn't there yet and that they did not have any towels.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with the location, services, cleanliness, and overall value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: mollyandsugar
Reviews.Content: The the moment we stepped into this beautiful historical hotel we were greeted by the doorman who was very helpful in assisting us. As we both wanted to stay in a historial hotel with history, we were surprised at how exceptionally clean and modern the hotel facilities were. Our room was very spacious with beautiful and comfortable bedding.We were assigned a room looking out over the streets of the city as I had requested upon booking. Overall, we were pleased with how close in proximity the hotel is located to the financial district, the museums and shopping areas. We will no doubt return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: fivefoldmin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Blake, having never been there before but seeing it listed on the internet. We were unsure because it cost less than some of the other hotels, and we did not want to show up and be dissapointed. We were not. We were greeted by a friendly staff that made us feel right at home. The rooms were spacious and very clean. I especially liked the oversize shower head in the beautiful marble shower! The complimentary breakfast was good, but we felt it could have used some additional items. All in all very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: rachelss
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Blake was perfect for our trip to Chicago to see the museums and enjoy the food. I wouldn't mind having my own house look like their rooms - I really enjoy staying in a place that doesn't have that generic hotel look. The location is walking distance to a lot of attractions and close to subway/El and bus stops for everything else. The Custom House downstairs has fabulous dinners. Wireless is included. However, the continental breakfast is very basic (muffins, bagels, coffee, tea) - go the Bongo Room at Roosevelt and Wabash. Our room had a view of the warehouse next door and the tops of a few buildings, but we were only there early in the morning and late at night - we were mostly out enjoying Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: WI_roam
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights - got the "Autumn Discount" from the web site so the rates were quite reasonable for the area & quality. Staff was friendly, room was nice. Enjoyed staying in a smaller hotel in a historic building. Easy walk to the Field Museum/Art Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: ballen6556
Reviews.Content: Pros...Bedding and pillows were absolutely amazing. Very comfortable. Evening doorman was very personable. Within walking distance of many low-midpriced restaurants. Short cab ride elsewhere in the south east loop area. Cons...Some mold in the shower. Air conditioning/heating vent was abnormally loud. (sounds like a regular bathroom exhaust fan, which there actually isn't one in the hotel room's bathroom) Our room came with a back alley view and the garbage trucks were very noisy starting at about 5am. Room could use more lighting and closet or drawer space. Overall, this is a nice looking and comfortable hotel, but maybe not worth the $280+ per night rate. I would recommend if paying closer to $150 p/n.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: javostinar
Reviews.Content: I felt the Blake was an excelent hotel based on the price and the location. The hotel was quite affordable based on other hotels in the area. The modern decor in the lobby and rooms was pleasant. It is convenently located near the heart of downtown. Most of all, the staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I have ever stayed in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: francesny
Reviews.Content: After speaking to their rep.and getting their very best price incl.auto.........we were pleasantly surprised at the friendliness and cleanliness of the hotel. Rec'd 2 free drinks and all of the staff was exceptional from the front desk,maids and doorman and waitstaff. Will stay there again in a heartbeat..........

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's hospitality leaves something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVirginiaMeg
Reviews.Content: We were excited about the location, in the center of Chicago, not too far from the Shedd Aquarium and Field Museum. We were also excited by the price, as this wasn't expensive for Chicago and supposedly included breakfast. And being an old printing factory, there was a bit of history too. The location, the rooms, all lived up to expectations â€“ and it was entirely walkable to our destinations of choice. However, the service was really something to be desired. Staff were curt, brusque and did not offer helpful details. We explained we had an early start the day we were leaving (5 minutes after breakfast was supposed to be served) - yet it was more like too bad, your loss that you won't be able to participate in our included breakfast service. We hovered over the breakfast staff, and not even a banana was put out for our early departure, which was 5 minutes after their supposed start time. When we called to request our car brought by the valet at a specific time, it was also brought 20 minutes early, and they got upset we didn't take it as soon as it was there -- we weren't ready to leave yet. I'd have to say if you are price conscious, you should consider staying here â€“ it was a good location and the rooms were clean and quiet. But donâ€™t get your expectations up that folks will be friendly or helpful. In another town we stayed in nearby, we actually got thanked for traveling during the recession and spending our dollars there â€“ which drew the comparison to the service at the Hotel Blake even more firmly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great staff - pricy parking”
Reviews.Author: jobema
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. The staff was very helpful and attentive. Room was well appointed. There was a bit of street noise as I was evidently there on "garbage pickup" morning. Otherwise a great hotel and location. In the printer's row area, near the old stock exchange. Close to quite a bit and right on a bus line. The only negative I have is that the overnight parking rate seemed high even for Chicago. It didn't help that there's a surface parking lot right across the street, but didn't appear to have anyone tending it. I'd enjoy hearing if there's anyone who's tried the lot or if there's an attended lot nearby someone has used? There's a Hackney's (local Chicago favorite American food restaurant) within walking distance as well as a Potbelly sandwich place right next door. There's also a 24 hour convenience store that's well stocked (7-11) right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: dsh310
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the comfort of the rooms and the courtesy of the staff at the hotel Blake in Chicago. The beds in the room were exceptionally comfortable, and the amenities of the complimentary cocktails and continental breakfast were a definite plus. The continental breakfast was unusually high quality. Most important, the value for the price was exceptional in a major city. Hats off!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: crednimisha
Reviews.Content: The Blake is in downtown chicago and a short walk to the Lakefront and an even shorter walk to a lot of really nice restaurants. Very comfortable room and excellent service. I'd stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly, a very positive exerience.”
Reviews.Author: drwn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blake with my wife while I was in town for business. It was a "mostly" very positive experience. The desk staff and the night door attendant were extremely helpful and polite. The room was slightly small. However, all the furnishings were up to date. The only negative was the day/morning door attendant got a little snippy with my wife when we asked him if he would store our bags for a few hours. Besides that, it was mostly a positive experience. You will not be disappointed if you stay at the Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff - Clean and Comfortable Room.”
Reviews.Author: unlmichael
Reviews.Content: Selected because of its central and convenient location, I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort of the room and the friendliness of the staff. Truly one of the best bargains in Downtown Chicago. Will be booking at least two return trips soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Englishteacher28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Blake was a lovely hotel with very spacious standard rooms and huge, beautiful bathrooms. The location on Printers Row was extremely handy and it was an easy walk to shopping, theater, and Grant Park. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again. The one small problem was a small amount of mold in the spacious shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very Acceptable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glrintreasurelake
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful with selecting a dining location.
