We checked our bags early in the day and obtained a late check-out the following day (2:00 p.m.) I had reserved one king bed but requested an upgrade on check-in and got it. Room was very spacious and very clean with very comfortable beds. There are in-room safes. Best of all, was the shower. The shower is huge with a half-door and amazingly the water stays contained within the shower. Only negative was to access our room after getting off the elevator, we have to go down 4-5 steps to access our room. Our luggage was heavy so it was a bit of a nuisance with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendky staff”
Reviews.Author: G10vanna
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 days in Chicago. We found the hotel blake in our lonely planet guide book. Excellent location, nice big room and friendly staff. Unfortunately the wi-fi connection was not working properly and breakfast was below our expectations, but on the whole it was a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Will always choose Hotel Blake!”
Reviews.Author: SabertoothLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We love Chicago and we love Hotel Blake. We have stayed there every summer for the past 5 years. We usually stay for at least 4-6 days. The hotel is in a good location and one can take a short bus ride to get to the Field Museum or just walk a couple of blocks to get to Michigan Avenue to do touristy stuff. The rooms are large, well decorated and extremely clean. We got an upgrade to a premium room but would have loved a suite (we are loyal patrons!) The staff is friendly and very helpful. They gave us good tips on good restaurants nearby. We will always come back to Hotel Blake because we have a wonderful stay there. See you next summer. This hotel deserves a higher star rating!!

Reviews.Title: “The Blake Hotel has the best of everything for a great stay,anytime.”
Reviews.Author: Quienten
Reviews.Content: Just returned to Wisconsin from a Wonderful 2 day stay at the Hotel Blake in Chicago. My wife found the Hotel on the internet. We needed a Hotel that would be close to all the sights we wanted to see. Entering the Hotel we found the Consierge to be very friendly and funny. The front desk clerks were also friendly and attentive to our needs and questions. Entering our room I was very pleased by both the size and cleanliness. Our room faced Dearborn with no noticable noise issues. Very quiet. With that said, my next trip to Chicago will include my wife and I staying at the Hotel Blake.

Reviews.Title: “The Blake is an exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: detroitbird
Reviews.Content: My wife, four year old son, and I stayed at the Blake for two nights. The hotel is very nice, contemporary, and hip. Our view from the suite was great, with the Sears Tower a block away. The free continental breakfast is very nice and with a variety of choices. All the employees were friendly and knew areas of Chicago quite well. Our room was very clean and decorated to our liking and style which made us feel right at home. We will be going back again in the future and would recommend the Hotel Blake to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake - A Gem”
Reviews.Author: jarh1952
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago. The Hotel Blake was recommended to us by friends. The rate was excellent and the location was central (walking distance to Art Institute and Millenium Park plus more). It was also very easy to access from the Interstate, The room was beautifully appointed and very large, with all the necessary amenities. The staff were all courteous, friendly and very helpful. The hotel was very quiet, which is a necessity for us. The only two drawbacks were as follows: 1) the shower in the bathroom had only a "half door", i.e., there was no way to close it and as a result, there was quite a bit of water on the floor after each shower, no matter how careful we were. 2) the continental breakfast was excellent, BUT there was very limited seating in the area in which the breakfast was served. It seemed a better idea to carry the breakfast to our room as there was no place to sit. These are minor complaints. In general, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Blake immensely! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy, child had to sleep on floor”
Reviews.Author: BMRJENSED
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, it did not meet the star quality rating. Pre paid for 2 rooms, asked that they be adjacent,or in close proximity with one rollaway for our child. No problem the front desk said around 2pm per phone conversation. When we arrived we were told no roll away, they were given out to those that had already checked in and paid. We pre paid, I said to the desk clerk, and even called ahead. You pre paid with Priceline he said in a demeaning manor.( As if I financially raped the hotel by paying 140 per room per night). My son slept on the floor, they did offer a suite after a visible complaint at the front desk by by husband , but not on the same floor as my mother and small children, forget it we said. We left our mother and 2 small children in the room the next morning to do an am dive at the harbor. We found out there is no morning room service, they went without breakfast. At appproximately 0615 we left the hotel to travel a short distance to the harbour to dive. We were met by road blocks every block. It took us 65 minutes to get to the harbour and then the dive charter had to drive his boat to meet us as there was a marathon going on. Do ya think the front desk could have given us a heads up as to the coming event the next morning, when we checked in? The staff at the Blake could careless about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi095
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Blake and it's definitely recommended. The location in Printers Row has its own points of interest â€“ eg some good little local restaurants, Millennium Park and the Art Institute are within walking distance. And local transport is very close if you want to go to N Michigan or other areas over the river. The hotel staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room is comfortable, and it's great to have something different to the usual bland hotel decor. All up, The Blake is a good quality hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding...The best place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: kfusinsk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is awesome. The service in phenomenal. The rooms are HUGE. The exercise facilities are outstanding. The Custom House resturant is wonderful. I can go on and on...I cannot say enough good things about Hotel Blake. I am planning to stay here for all of my Chicago trips from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Docsam
Reviews.Content: Might be a historic hotel but it shows its age. Rooms and even public areas badly need renovation. Location is great for walking that Magnificient Mile and surrounding area but that's about it. Got it at a great price on Priceline "name your own price" as a 4 star deluxe hotel. Would rate it as 3 star at most. Happy with stay and room for thae price but definitely not if I had to pay retail.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: momof4kiddos
Reviews.Content: My husband I and stayed at this wonderful hotel June 3-6. We love it here. The hotel is super nice and the staff were really friendly. I liked the area, we were close to everything. They actually had a book fair outside the day we were leaving. I was really nervous about the area because I had never stayed in downtown Chicago and have only been there one other time. But it worked out great for us. We went site seeing and went to see some of our family in the suburbs too. We were close to transportation. I think that took us all of 5 min to get there. We ate at Potbelly's next door and that was very very yummy. Perfect for a quick lunch and back out sight seeing. I would definatley stay here again. The only think that really bothered me was the vent looked like it needed to be replaced. I thought it was grimy but ended up being paint. Considering how old the hotel is,it is very nicely updated and decorated. We had a great view and were up to the street and barely heard anything. Now if you slept in until 10 or 11 maybe but I was up and out of the hotel by 8 and seriously the noise was not a issue. My favorite thing about this hotel was the bathrooms, they are killer!! OH, just be careful about the floor were you go get ice. My husband went up there and said it is quite scary especially at 11pm. I can't wait to go back I give this hotel a A+!!

Reviews.Title: “New to the City”
Reviews.Author: phoenixsue
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to the City to register her for college. She will be attending Columbia College in the fall. We had no idea where to stay,eat or how tour the city. The hotel was perfect in every way for our stay. Close walking access to the college,free breakfast every morning, across the street from the Lakefront (I love to run so I could easily get to the lake path), very friendly staff. We did not know what to do in the evening the staff knew where to send us and how to get around. The Hotel is extremely clean and beautifully decorated. This will be my hotel of choice each time I visit my daughter at Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the Loop for a solo traveler who wants good value”
Reviews.Author: CHIP72
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Blake for a leisure trip to Chicago for 5 nights from 7/7 to 7/12. I can only say good things about my stay there. Considering I wanted to pay less than $150/night and all my travel during my Chicago stay would be via public transit, the hotel was in an excellent location, very close to various Chicago "L" stations on many lines (the Library stop on the Loop itself, the Jackson stops on both the Blue and Red Lines, the LaSalle stop on the Blue Line, and the Harrison stop on the Red Line). Though the area near the hotel isn't the most built-up location in downtown Chicago, there still were a few restaurants and convenience stores nearby (the latter of which, both 7-Eleven and CVS, I utilized numerous times). Service in the hotel was good too - the rooms were cleaned thoroughly early each day, there was free, 24-7 internet access (though only one computer so sometimes I had to wait to get on), and a continental breakfast was available each morning (though I only used that the day I checked out and the options were somewhat limited). The cooling units in the rooms worked well too, making it more comfortable to sleep. From the room I had, I even had an excellent view of the Sears Tower (it will never be the Willis Tower and besides, when I was there it still was officially the Sears Tower!). The staff seemed friendly enough, though I didn't need their services much during my stay. All in all, Hotel Blake served as an excellent base of operations for me during my stay in Chicago (which primarily involved going to a pair of Cubs and a pair of White Sox games, riding around the CTA "L" system, checking out the major train stations, checking out various neighborhoods and attractions both via transit and on foot, and taking a day trip up to Milwaukee to check out that city and go to a Brewers game - Hotel Blake is probably about 3/4 mile from Chicago Union Station). I'd definitely be interested in staying at Hotel Blake again during a future Chicago visit if their rates remain relatively low.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed-not what others are saying”
Reviews.Author: WTnTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel and booked it because of the price and what others were saying about the hotel on TripAdisor. I was dissappointed. Day shift bellhop was rude the minute we got out of the car. (Night shift bellhop, Greg, was excellent and funny) We arrived at 3 pm but did not realize until 8 pm that we only had 2 towels in the room (we had 4 in the room) We called for more towels, but you can only get towels from 8 to 6 when housekeeping is there! There are not many places to eat or do shopping, most close at 5 pm or 7pm. I was concerned about what they call 'secure parking' as a part of my $39.00 valet parking. Your car is actually in a public parking garage underground and your keys stay in your car with the window down (so flys or bugs can crawl in), so take every with you into the hotel. Rooms were ok (they charge you an extra $50.00 at checkin but will refund it to you after you leave as long as you don't mess up the room or steal anything (ha) - beds were not comfortable at all, hard. Next time, we will stay in the River North area, more eateries, shopping, Navy Pier and closer to the 'el' trains and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Blake Hotel Chicago - WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: talondavis
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Blake Hotel in Chicago. I would definately go back. The service there was excellent, better than any other service I have had in the past. Jesse, the doorman was very helpful with information about where certain eateries were located at and also th best way to get around the town. The room was fantanstic with a king bed and a large walk-in shower. The staff was very courtious at all times. The continental breakfast was also good. Overall, I would say that my stay at the Blake was not only relaxing but in general an excellent experience that I would do again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend was a bust due to hotel blake”
Reviews.Author: golfpro261
Reviews.Content: I had booked through Blakes website over a month in advance and a deal on the room with no cancellation allowed. We got to the off ramp on congress and was .9 miles from the hotel and it took just under 2 hours to get there due to traffic. We finally show up after dealing with all that traffic and come to find out there had given away our room and we had no where to stay in their hotel that night. Not off to a good start since we were going to the Brewers/Cubs game in the morning bright and early. They ended up putting us up in the holiday inn for the night for free and payed for the taxi to get us over there. So we had to park our car at the hotel for the night and hoped we had what we needed. When we got to the holiday inn, they had no record of Blake sending us there, they had only 4 reservations and i was not one of them. After another wait, they wrote my name over some other person they had reservations for from the Blake(not sure what they did with the other person when they showed). Once we got to the room, it was a smoking room! My girlfriend is allergic to smoke and those were the only rooms they had there. So after a horrible night, we had to wake up and pack up again bright and early to go back to the blake. This was not before we found out the holiday inn did not have a complimentary breakfast like the Blake was going to have. So after taking a cab back to blake, we went to have our luggage checked since a room would not be available until 3 PM which is 3 hours after the Brewer game started. Once we got the luggage checked, they said we could have breakfast there. It was the worst possible breakfast i had ever seen. They had one guy cutting and toasting bagels in a 4 slice toaster, pound cake cut and wrapped individually and honey buns. The juice was stuck in a bucket of ice when some ran out so it was not even cold. The bagel my girlfriend got had mold on the bottom of the bagel as well. Went to the game(Brewers killed 11-2) and when we got back, they had upgraded us to the larger king size room. The room was nice and well maintained. When we woke up the next morning, we had no hot water! We called down to the front desk and they brought up a key card to take a shower in the only other open room which was nice. They ended up taking off some of the total which helped in the end to make things somewhat right. Seems like a decent place as long as you have a room and go out for breakfast. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: decolombelle
Reviews.Content: I arrived from NY fraught, dirty and hot. The reception from the staff at Hotel Blake sorted the first of those - efficient and courteous to a fault - and the wonderful rain-head shower in the bathroom sorted the last two. Room service for a late lunch was as good as reception, with much to tempt on the room service menu. I felt completely restored within an hour. The bar staff were friendly and helpful, while the food in the restaurant for a business dinner was very good indeed. I also greatly appreciated breakfast being provided - much more what I'm used to, coming from the UK. Location was quiet, but perfectly convenient, the room was spacious, the bed wonderfully comfortable. If I have any quibbles at all, it was the provision of only one computer in the business centre - there was always a queue to use it! I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_TravellerX2
Reviews.Content: My husband, daugher and I stayed at Hotel Blake in May - our first time in Chicago. Everything was great - the hotel staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was large and well appointed, and the bathroom was large and luxurious. The beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast (included) is simply some bagels, juice and coffee served in the lobby, but good enough to start the day. We thought the location was good - a few blocks from the waterfront and Buckingham fountain. From there we walked to Millenium Park and then down Michigan Avenue, the Magnificent Mile shopping area to Hancock Tower (which I recommend for a view of Chicago - go an hour or so before sunset and stay until afterwards to get both day and night views). The Hotel Blake is located in the business area which is quiet in the evening, but the concierge/doorman recommended bars/restaurants we could walk to. We also found that taxis were very reasonable. The valet parking is pricey, but we checked the area and all parking seemed quite expensive. It was convenient and safe, so it was worth it to us. My son has since stayed at Hotel Blake for a weekend in a king bed room and also had a positive experience - the room was large, luxuriously appointed and very comfortable and the staff were great. When in Chicago, we will definitely stay at Hotel Blake!

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled by photos...”
Reviews.Author: fmjmemphis
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of the photos online and the price for a package through Priceline. While I generally trust the site and I always double check with Trip Advisor obvisouly this slipped by me. I was greeted in the Lobby by a drunken guest, andf super loud doorman. I told the counter agent that my flight was 10 hours late, that I had a early morning meeting and she then put me on a floor with a girls night out party facing the street! The temparature in Chicago right now is 60 and my room is freezing cold. I called for a blanket and they told me that they do not have any more???? Huh? There are no amenities here and my dinner was a bag of Hot Fries from the 7-11\ and if you park your car you are going to pay $39.00 to park. Are you kidding? Okay, I thought I had a deal but this is a dud...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Blake at Chicago, Illinois from May 9 to May 15. The service at the hotel was great. The people at the front desk/doorman/cleaning lady were very friendly and helpful. The room was a very clean and nice.... bed was very comfortable. I love the location of the hotel. It's located at the south end of the downtown area. There are a lot of nice restaurants near the hotel. We walked to the Art Institute, Millennium Park, downtown and Michigan Ave for shopping. We caught a bus to the Field Museum, Navy Pier and Chinatown. The price of the hotel was very reasonable (we got a 30 percent discount for the spring sale at the hotel). The only complaints- no refrigerator and microwave. I will definitely stay at the hotel again and recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Hotel Blake in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pacecar
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently into Chicago for business and this was my first stay at the Hotel Blake. I was really impressed with the Hotel and the attached restaurant. Check in / out was friendly, fast, and easy. The rooms were extremely nice and the overall facility was excellent. I would strongly recommend the Hotel Blake for business and leisure travel. Great value, great location, great place!

Reviews.Title: “nice classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: smurfette27
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Very neat and clean. Comfortable bed. Beautifully decorated. Great location. Friendly staff. The price was unbeatable! But don't use the vallet parking if you have a vehicle because it costs just as much as a one night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: rangertera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently vacationed in Chicago for four nights at the Hotel Blake. Our room was nice for how little we were there, and seemed reasonable for a Standard King for $117 a night (AAA member). We were upgraded to a King room with a desk and other furniture, but the Internet was not working at the hotel, so the desk seemed worthless. Bathroom was huge. When I noticed our room did not have a coffee maker as the website indicates, I mentioned it to the desk woman who kindly wrote it down, then I never heard. When I went back the next night to ask in person, I was told the hotel was full and there were no coffee makers available. This did not seem acceptable to me, but I did not make an issue. Had I made an issue of it, perhaps I would've gotten a coffee pot, but that's not a fun vacation to me. There is a continental breakfast offered at 7a.m. where I came down and got coffee in my p.j's. One of the nights, my husband and I did get wafts of sewage smell. That was one night, on the fifth floor. I read a review from Oct. 2008 where someone also smelled sewage on the 5th floor. In warmer weather, I might be concerned about it being worse? Don't know what the deal is there. The door men are the nicest and most helpful people there. Desk reception is cordial, responding to you as though you've pushed a button for a pre-programmed response. I suppose it's not the funnest job in the world, but the door men seem to be making the most of it. I wouldn't expect reception to solve a problem for me, and unless you had a problem, there's be no reason to find reception unacceptable. Just hope for no problems. We'll look into other places in the future, but the price certainly was right.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Blake: nice boutique(-like) hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tomj_canada
Reviews.Content: Located in the Printer's Row district (Loop-South Loop border) the Hotel Blake, while not at the center of the action, is conveniently located. You can easily walk, or ride either the bus or the El Train to most of the interesting venues. There are a good lot of restaurants (Potbelly's, Amarit (thai), etc) and coffee shops (Starbucks, Panera Bread) in the neighborhood if you don't want to eat at Custom House , on the main floor of the hotel. Again, you can walk to the Loop to enjoy the best. Regarding the rooms, they are well furnished and seemed quite newly renovated. Light sleepers: ask a room away from the street as the windows are thin and let street noise go through more than usually. The downside: you loose the view. While they call it a boutique hotel, I would say it's fairly close to the edge of being a "mainstream" hotel. Aside from that, the staff at the desk were friendly, yet not joyful, completely opposite to the doorman, who was always willing to help us on our journey! At the time cheaper than most of comparable hotels, the Blake is definitely a good bet!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: jdrisc
Reviews.Content: We stay in Chicago every year at the Hilton for the St Paddys Day Parade. This year we went on a limb to stay at the Blake because it was half the price. We were thrilled with this boutique hotel. The location was great (1.5 blks from the CTA blue line, which if you are coming from O'Hare is ideal). 3 blks from Michigan Ave and had several stores, restaurants, and coffeeshops in the area for quick pick-ups. The staff were very friendly and the room was spacious, nicely decorated, and clean. You could tell the hotel tried to provide special extras to make your stay more memorable. They also provided a basic continental breakfast, which was great. We did not go into the bar or restaurant but they looked lovely. This hotel also had free access to the work out area and free WiFi, all of which the Hilton do not provide. This is now our new favorite hotel, for our get-aways from the kids!!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid time at the Hotel Blake!”
Reviews.Author: vtfancie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Blake last week and had a splendid time! The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed, the beds are comfy and we had a great view of the Harold Washington Library. Hotel Blake is now serving a complimentary continental breakfast...most appreciated! Great location, close to the "L" and subway and in walking distance of the Art Institute, Cultural Center, Buddy Guy's and theaters. It was our first time in Chicago and we look forward to returning...and staying at the Hotel Blake!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Blake”
Reviews.Author: ryno42
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had decided on a weekend getaway and picked the Blake Hotel because of the price and the location. We were blown away by the service, friendly employees and excellant location. Only located a mile or two from the Sears tower, Amtrak and Museum Campus, we found it extremely easy to navigate our way around town. We were only a few minute cab ride from restaurants north of us, or bars anywhere in the city. The room was clean and modern and didn't worry about being bothered by any staff. When we had questions regarding locations, the staff assisted us with maps and the door man hailed cabs and directed us to different places around the city. I would go back in a heart beat. I would also recommend the city pass, for only $59 you can go to 5 spots around the city. We went to the Shedd Aquarium, The Sears & the Field Museum. The pass is good until May, so you can keep the vouchers for another day. It also allows you to skip the lines and see shows that normally cost extra while your there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pattersean
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews my wife and I decided to take a chance at the Blake. We experienced none of the things that other reviewers had issues with and plan to stay at this hotel the next time we go to Chicago. The staff was very courteous and helpful, pointing us in the direction of good local restaurants and making sure we knew which way we were heading on public transportation. A good find in a great part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel during the conference in December. The location of the hotel is good. It is near the Museum campus, Grant park, Art institute and two blocks away from the Blue line subway. There is Panera Bread nearby, so grabbing for breakfast or lunch is easy. The reception at the counter was very nice and friendly. Her name is Desiree. We first stayed at the Hilton Hotel, a few blocks away, and moved to this hotel because of problem with reservation. We arrived early, around 10 am. When Desiree learned that we had to head out for the conference, she searched for the cleaned available room and let us check in right away. Thank you for being helpful. Hotel Blake is really good value for the money. It is cheaper than the Hilton with similar location and room amenities. If you are not looking for grand entrance or fancy lobby, I think Hotel Blake is a good choice. The wireless connection is free here, but is charged by the 5 star hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worst I Have Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Callbala
Reviews.Content: I came in on Oct 5th 2008 at 4.30pm. (funny its today). they gave me Rm.520. Within 15 min I could get septic drainage smell inside the room thru the vents and called the guest service. THey said, they will give another room and I am typing this from the other room. there is no smell here but the hallway stinks. The room man said "At least you don't have the smell inside your room now"!! And to make things even worse, the previous room did not even have drapes. Now, please think twice before choosing this hotel. I will be getting out very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lostsol95
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this Hotel before booking it and I was a little skeptical. However, after staying there for four nights, I am pleased with my choice. The hotel staff was always courteous and attentive. The doormen were hilarious and helpful. And the hotel itself was very nice. I didn't have any issues with my room. It was serviced everyday with fresh towels and straightened up a bit. The only downside was a slight smell of dampness in the hallways, which didn't reflect the room. Besides that, it was the most reasonably priced hotel and still in a decent location for where I needed to get to in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsoutherngirl
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a decent hotel. Location was great, staff was helpful enough to get me in and out. The place definitely needs some upgrading and cleaning up, but again, for the money, I would stay there again next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trust This Place With Your Credit Card Number”
Reviews.Author: Seattletraveler000
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place at all costs. My organization booked 20 rooms at the Blake for an upcoming event nearby. When we needed to make changes to the reservations, we found the reservation line went unanswered, and responses by email were very slow. I finally visited the surprisingly dumpy Blake in person and found chaos and angry customers at the front desk. My handwritten note to the General Manager to please call me ASAP was never answered. We then cancelled all of our rooms about a week ahead of time. The Blake sent an email confirming the cancellations and promising that none of us would be charged. Despite that promise, the Blake charged my credit card for one night's stay and did the same to one of my colleagues. The Blake did not respond to my faxes, emails, letters or phone calls, but eventually my credit card company persuaded the Blake to reverse the charges. Four months later, however, my colleague is still fighting to have her $179 charge reversed. No one at the Blake will respond to her in any way. Between the two of us we've spent dozens of hours trying to reverse charges that should never have been imposed in the first place. Incredibly bad customer service, and an incredibly frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, did I just pay that much for this?”
Reviews.Author: pheaton
Reviews.Content: My Pros: The area of town isn't too bad. If you have some good shoes you can walk to just about anything you would like restaurant-wise. It's possible to walk to the Lake and Navy Pier from there, but it would be a bit of a hike. There are a few restaurants in the immediate area so if you aren't picky and don't want to walk far you're set. Our room (#524) was on the end so we had 2 huge windows one facing north, the other facing east, which gave us a very nice view of the area, which included the Sears Tower. These windows also had blackout drapes which meant a nicely darkened room when it was time for bed. The room had a large bathroom with a double sink and a really nice (rain-like) showerhead. The complimentary bathroom supplies were from Bath and Body Works, which had a nice smell. Plenty of towels for 2 people, and a bath robe. The Plasma TV was lowend, but decent Vizio (WalMart) brand, but it worked ok to watch the cable with HBO. The chairs were comfortable, and the bed was very very comfortable. The tall 12' ft (I think) ceilings made the room seem big. Lastly there was free wireless internet throughout the the hotel at no additional cost. My Cons: The price. Probably my fault, I had to book last minute, so I had to pay the webprice ($350 + tax) for this room. This price might be worth it if it weren't for the following. The room door was falling apart and hard to open and close because it was sticking in the jamb. The A/C was a pain to control, it seemed to have 2 settings, off or freezing. Our room because of the 2 windows made the city noise come right to the room. I can sleep through anything so it did't bother me, but light sleepers beware. The toilet didn't flush right you had to hold the handle down. The bathrobes finally came after a 2nd call. The doorman made a Omaha Nebraska guy like me feel a little uncomfortable. He seemed nice, but a little shiesty. He informed us that he could park our car in the garage for $39 per night, or he could put it on the meter for $10. We opted for the meter, but that meant our car would have to stay put, or we risk losing the meter. This meant we were walking anywhere we had to go for that night. I'm not sure why the $10 though, I thought the meters were free after a certian hour on Saturday. I think he profited from that one directly. No fridge? At this price? The staff didn't seem to be too bright, but fortunately I didn't really require them to be, as I didn't really need them for anything, except change for a 5. At checkout I forgot to give them their room key-cards back. They either didn't want them, or weren't bright enough to remember to ask for them. Lastly, when we got to our floor, it smelled like dirty laundry, housekeeping had bags of dirty linens all over the floor, and there was one room with a room service tray outside in the hallway that hadn't been picked up, when we came back from dinner the smell had gone for the most part, but the room service tray was still there, this had to of been 2 or 3 hours later. Other Stuff: There is a coffee pot for you coffee drinkers. It's located in the bathroom, which I thought was weird, but whatever. There was a hair blowdryer in there too if you need one. There is a phone in the bathroom next to the toilet, I guess this is in case you have some emergency that requires a phone call, or a call downstairs while on the can. I never went for ice, but I think there is only 1 ice machine in the whole place, so plan for that. They told me there as a health club too, but again I didn't check it out. Same for the restaurant, I checked their menu online and figured that I wasn't spending that much for a little nibble. If you want to catch a cab I think the doorman will put his life on the line for you to get one. The EL Train and Subway stops were within walking distance, but that's true for just about any part of town. Staff seemed a little snobbish, but they weren't rude. I didn't see too many elevators, in fact, I only saw 2. They worked ok, but come checkout time they will get stuffed. I was on 5th floor, by the time the elevator got to me there was barely enough room for me to squeeze in, then the elevator proceeded to stop on 4 and 3 to pick up more people, whom couldn't fit. So I imagine if you weren't lucky, you'd be waiting for awhile, or taking the stairs. The stairwells were dirty by the way. Conclusion: I might stay here again if I were to get a really good price, but mostly likely I would try to find something else. It was ok, but I don't think worth the price. This hotel seems to be tethering on the edge of being pretty nice, or really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Weltenbummler57
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the hotel. First in February 2008, because it was close to the EL. As the service was excellent, the room modern, clean and comfortable, we decided to spend another weekend in July with my nephew and our 3 bikes. The assistance we received with storing our bikes and making them available whenever we needed them, exceeded our hopes. The nearby parking was also very convenient. As we arrived ahead of check in time, our luggage was stored until the rooms were ready, again it was stored after check out, until we returned from our Lakeshore bike trip. This hotel and its staff is recommendable in every aspect. Thanks for the great stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a MISS”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: This noisy hotel is on the corner of Dearborn and Congress, two major streets with lots of buses and an above ground metro one block away. The double pain windows do not cut the noise. If you are from a city a love noise, then this is your hotel. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are comfortable. That's a plus. We were upgraded to a corner room #524. Beautiful views. When I commented on the noise and said we could not sleep well, they said the only rooms above ours were suites. We kept our room.Trust me, it's noisy, throughout the night. NO morning newspapers. NO twice daily maid service. NO bottled water. This used to be a Hyatt, but while claiming to be a boutique hotel they don't even get the most basic of hotel services. There are so few people staying here that the restaurant, Custom House, quit serving breakfasts because there wasn't enough business. If you want ice, you'll be going up to the 12th floor to find the ice machine. The hallway carpets, at least on floor five were stained in several places and needed a deep cleaning. This hotel is a mile from Sears Tower and a mile from Art Institute of Chicago. The same goes for Wrigley Field if you happen to be catching a Cubs game. OTHERWISE, there is nothing close to this hotel. It's on the far south end of the loop and boy did we boo-boo picking this hotel because it's not near anything. Well, the Chicago library is a block away as is the city jail! If you are looking for a hotel in the Miracle Mile area where most of the tourist activities take place, this is NOT the hotel to choose. The hotel advertises a concierge, but it is really the front desk, which while as helpful as they try to be, are not trained concierges. Wireless service does not work in the lobby, though it does work in the rooms. The only reason to stay here is for the rock bottom hotel rates that can be found on some discount websites. There is also a Starbucks on the corner and Orange, a breakfast restaurant around the corner. All in all, we would never stay here again. The rooms are great but there is nothing else going on, unless you absolutely have appointments in this area, there are far better hotels with far better services in Chicago....and at similar prices. We thought this was a MISS and not a little miss a BIG MISS.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories at Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: KariRN
Reviews.Content: My dear boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Blake June 27-June 29, 2008 after wanting a hotel that wasn't another "chain". We booked the weekend stay on Expedia.com and check in was a breeze. The room was prepaid and all they needed was a signature and a credit card to put on file for incidentals. We were assigned a King Classic room on the 6th floor...clean room, beautiful bed and bedding, large bathroom with large shower, great free tioletries from Bath and Body Works. However, not a great view. Actually, no view at all, just the side of a brick building, but this was expected seeing as how we didn't splurge for a suite and it is the city of Chicago! We didn't take advantage of the restaurant but we did walk to city quite a bit. Ate at Hackneys for burgers just down the block. There is easy access to the el, and many restaurants...Starbuck, Potbelly, Edwardos, small little Italian resurants and a 7-11 on the block. I did encounter one small problem on my return from our stay. We had checked out and were told there were no incidentals, however the next day my credit card they had on file had been charged $100.00. I called and spoke with the front desk who informed me that when they take your credit card on file they "automatically" set aside $50.00 per day and that if it is not used, it is reimbursed. It was in fact reimbursed the next day, however it would have been nice to know this up front. Overall, it was a lovely cozy, CLEAN stay at Hotel Blake with a great location and we would definetly recommend it and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AngusMac
Reviews.Content: We got a very reasonable price at the Hotel Blake via Hotels.ca in a normally expensive city. The hotel was easy to find, not far from the Lasalle station at the south end of the Loop. With several other El train stops nearby and the bus across the road, it's in a great location for all the tourist sites in Chicago. Potbelly's and Starbucks are a few steps away. The only downside was the traffic noise at night, but that is hard to avoid in a big, busy city. Dearborn is a relatively quiet street, but Chicago drivers use their horns a lot. The climate system provided enough white noise to allow a good nights sleep. The building is an older heritage building, but nicely updated inside. Check-in was easy, computer access was handy just off the lobby and staff were very friendly at all times. We had to walk up one short flight of stairs from the elevator, but if that's a problem then you will really struggle with the subway steps in Chicago. Room was very large, nicely furnished with a big comfortable bed. Bathrooms are huge, with two sinks, nicely tiled with a rain-type shower head. The room was so comfortable it provided a welcome place for a mid-day break. The Hotel Blake was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in and I would recommend it to anyone looking for quality at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: redanimal
Reviews.Content: I had a very mixed experience at Hotel Blake. Good stuff: - Large room with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom/shower - Good location, walkable to the loop, lake and many train stops - Staff was responsive to room change request, fax service and holding baggage Bad stuff: - Wifi barely worked at all, even after I switched rooms to get better reception. This was a semi-business trip and I did not appreciate heading out into the hallway to check my email - No fridge in the room - Odd beeping in the hallway that, according to the front desk, was normal and couldn't be stopped. Not very bothersome, just strange. I got a great deal on this place but I wouldn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: mslovespink
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice, but the service was HORRIBLE and we barely slept - the beds look nice but are uncomfortable, it was noisy, the walls must be thin, we could hear everything outside- we got very little sleep!.. The weird thing is, the elevators dont go to every floor, so we had to get off at a floor below ours, and carry our luggage up the stairs....and, I had a cold shower (I called downstairs to tell them there was no hot water, and they said "the engineer will be in at 9, he'll call you then"--- I had to be at work before then, so that didn't help), then the blow dryer didn't work, and they didn't come up with a new one for such a long time, I had to leave for work with a cold, wet head. Also, one of the employees literally yelled at me about a credit card "issue" that actually ended up not being an issue at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Not far from public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: stokobr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night in the Blake. We parked near Union Station and used public transportation to reach the hotel (the el stops only one block away from the hotel). The hotel was very nice, but the location was not fantastic for tourist accessibility. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The room was quite large and comfortable. We were able utilize the public transportation again to get to the magnificent mile. Since the public transportation is so extensive in Chicago, the location was not a problem. If I was looking for a business hotel, I would defiantly stay at the Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: Fiveironfeffi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a pre-Christmas trip to Chicago and found this hotel and absolutely loved it!!! We had a fantastic trip to the Windy City while staying at this centrally located hotel. The hotel was very elegant with great service. The location just couldn't be beat. We were a short cab or bus ride from it all. When we got in we hopped on the blue line from O'Hare and 45 mins we got off about a block from the hotel. Once we checked into our room we saw a pizza place across the street and we didnt know a better way to start off our trip than a deep dish pizza. The place was Edwardo's Natural Pizza and it was amazing. We were in walking distance from Grant Park and did so. We got to walk to the Sears Tower and the famous Lou Mitchell's. We loved the hotel and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds in Town!”
Reviews.Author: Spacesales
Reviews.Content: Stay in Chicago weekly and found the Blake based on great rates. The beds and the great showers made my stay. MUST eat at Potbelly's next door - also Starbucks across the street and awesome breakfast at Orange around the corner. Steps away from everything and best yet - you have money left in your pocket when you leave. Oh yeah - FREE Internet

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in room 306.”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: Past negative reviews on this site are not reflective of our experience in room #306 of Hotel Blake. The mixed reviews do lead me to believe that room conditions can vary. Positive Points: 1. Price - I paid $101/night Canadian. I got this as a package deal on a well-known travel web site. We stayed at the hotel during the March break (week of March 10th, 2008). 2. Size - We couldn't believe the size of our room! We had a King sized bed, a nice bay window with a bench/seat (and a bench at the end of our bed), more than enough space for open luggage, and a super-sized washroom. You can do jumping jacks in this bathroom! There are two sinks, and a large shower stall. 3. Style - It is refreshing to be in a botique style hotel - this gives it charm and character, something you don't get from other cookie-cutter chain hotels. Take a look at the pictures. 4. Location - Everything is within walking distance. Yes, it is located in the southern part of the Loop, but it did not take us long to walk from one end of the town to the other (e.g. from this hotel to the John Hancock tower). It is also close to a couple of transit stops. We took the El train from the Midway airport, got off at the Library transit stop, and walked half a block to this hotel. Negative Points: 1. Internet not working - it is well advertised that this hotel has a free internet terminal available for guests. Therefore we made a conscious decision to not bring our heavy laptop with wireless internet. Well, the hotel internet terminal was out of order during our entire stay. I was annoyed enough to voice my discontent a couple of times. In response, they let us use their own staff computer behind the front desk. Bravo! 2. Ridiculous phone charges - the list of services in the room leads you to believe that you will not be charged for out-going calls placed on a calling card. Well, when we checked out and got a bill for over $20 in calls, we learned otherwise. However, after some more â€˜voiced discontentâ€™ (including a reminder to them that we wouldnâ€™t need to be placing these calls if their internet hadnâ€™t been down all week) they dropped the charges. I commend the hotel staff for turning these two negative points into positives. Other hotel tips and tid-bits: Â· You get some Bath & Body Works goodies in the bathroom (see pic), and they replenish. Â· Our towels were replaced everyday, unlike some other reviews. Â· The deep-dish pizza place across the street, Edwardoâ€™s, is really good. And the Starbuckâ€™s across the street is handy. Â· The exercise room on the 2nd floor has a great panoramic urban view. Â· If the internet isnâ€™t working when you stay at this hotel, just go to the beautiful library on the next block where there is free internet and many terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: nutstarr02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago, but wanted to warn other TA members about this place. I'm not sure if things have gotten any better, but I don't want to risk finding out. I would never stay here again! Although the hotel was brand new and in a good location, the service was terrible! We should've known when we checked in. There was a woman who was upset because she was taking a shower and other hotel guests had walked in. Well, it turns out that the check-in desk had given them keys to her room thinking it was empty. Eek! Then it was our turn. We had booked a room with confirmed double beds (for four people) and when we showed up they had apparently given all the double-bed rooms away and ran out of rolller beds too. We had to alternate sleeping on the floor. They offered us no compensation except to not charge us for the roller beds when we finally were able to get one! This is not 4-star hotel service for sure! Valet was an additional price (expensive, but that's the norm in Chicago). However, it took them at least 20 minutes to get our car each time! By the third time we needed our car, we learned to call at least 20 minutes in advance from when we wanted to leave. In conclusion, we had a terrible experience here and the staff was not apologetic at all when we expressed our concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake - An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: tms309
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Blake for 3 days recently and were quite impressed. Many of the previous reviews left us a bit skeptical prior to our stay, but the price we received was quite good ($109/night) for the area, so we decided to try it for ourselves. The location was excellent, close to most destinations in the Loop area (such as the Chicago Art Institute, for example). In fact, the El has a stop about a block away, so also very easy access to public transportation. The neighborhood also seemed safe Although, there is a sandwich shop, pizza parlor, and Starbucks on the block, we did note that it was a bit difficult to find many restaurants open in the Loop at night, given that this is the really the Financial District and many establishments seem to close around 5pm. Again, however, with the proximity to the El and other trains so close, it was relatively easy to travel to other neighborhoods for dinner in the evening. As for the hotel itself, the lobby upon entry was tastefully decorated with minimalist/modern decor. The check-in procedure was smooth and the front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. Our room was huge and also well-designed and nicely appointed with a king bed, pull-out sofa, two armchairs, large desk, and a wonderfully large bathroom with glass shower. Incidentally, we had friends who were staying at the Hilton a few blocks away and their room was more than twice the price and half the size! It is also worth noting that the cleaning staff was also very good and arrived promptly every morning to change our linens. In general, we would highly recommend this hotel for business or personal travel, particularly for those who prefer quieter, non-high maintenance retreats. We found it very peaceful at the Hotel Blake and were all around very pleased with our stay. We'd definitely consider returning there on future visits to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A very strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: shegog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Blake on New Years' Eve with my partner, and the hotel had a lot of great features- the rooms are big, the bathroom is large, and there was free wi-fi. The hotel is also in a really great area. It's a short cab ride to the West Loop, and steps from the Theater District. But there were a lot of things that were conspicuosly absent - there was no mirror in the main room, and the bathroom outlets did not work. the bathroom was also missing towel bars and a toilet paper holder. I'm not sure if the hotel is under new management, but the combination of great features and conspicuously absent items that even a Motel 6 would have was kind of strange!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: chinchilla01
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Blake appeared charming yet contemporary when I saw the photos online. It did indeed have that Chicago charm. The room, accented in red, was very contemporary and large. The decor was great and didn't feel like we were in a hotel room. The bed (a king) was very comfortable. The bathroom was huge too with a rainshower head! The staff was also very friendly. My boyfriend and I had bought a bottle of wine for the evening and failed to remember that we did not have a means to open it. They were very nice and sent someone to the room to cork it for us along with a couple of wine glasses. We also arrived over an hour before check in time and were able to check in early. On the other hand, considering the price ($150/night) there were a lot of little weird negatives about the hotel. It was kind of on a sleepy street. The room service menu was pretty meek. The only ice machine was on the 12th floor (we were on the 7th). There was no toliet paper holder...it looked like it had broken off. There was no mini-fridge (to put bottles of water and tea we bring everywhere with us) or desk (not business trip friendly). Overall, it was good but not great. If we had paid a bit less I probably would have been a little less critical of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lot of potential, too bad the upkeep and maintenance stinks”
Reviews.Author: tbtraveller
Reviews.Content: We're frequent visitors to Chicago and were curious to try out this hotel. We got a great winter rate ($99/night). When we checked in in the evening the staff were very pleasant, cheerful and competent. We threw our bags down in our room after a quick once over and went out to meet our friend's new baby. The room was nicely decorated in a modern style and bigger then I expected, with plush furniture and nice window treatments. Sadly we didn't notice the three very large chunks of peeling paint hanging from the shower ceiling or the mildew stains all over the shower floor. The mildew I could live with, but the big (over 6 inches) pieces of paint barely attached to the ceiling really grossed me out. We didn't notice until right before bed, so we thought we'd just ignore it and let them know in the morning when we checked out since they seemed so nice when we checked in. When we were checking out we told the woman behind the desk and she didn't care at all. She didn't apologize for the state of the bathroom and just laughed it off. I wish I had taken pictures, it was that disgusting. Too bad, because the hotel does have a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Problems!”
Reviews.Author: lynnlovestennis
Reviews.Content: Just Google "Nicky O" (as in Nicky Hilton) to read up on why Hotel Blake has had so many bad reviews on TA lately. We stayed there as part of a wedding group with a block of over 30 rooms, and many in our group had stayed at the Blake previously due to its proximity to the bride and groom's place. Other than that, no one had much good to say about the hotel except that the rooms are spacious. The rooms are, in fact, quite spacious. There's no disputing that. But they're also in much disrepair. We had two TP roll holders in our bathroom which were pulled off the wall and laid on the counter. The knobs to the TV armoir were also loose, and the TV itself was a big cathode tube thing circa 1998 with only about 20 channels and HBO. Add to this that we didn't have a dresser in our room; though under the TV, where a mini-bar or drawers *could* have been, was a big empty cavern. All the rooms are different, though I only saw one room with a dresser at all. And definitely no mini-bars. During our four days there, we had our room made up twice and we never received fresh towels, despite calling repeatedly. I did call once and ask for hangers due to the lack of dresser drawers, and fortunately got those. Wifi is available, which is a plus, but it doesn't always work. If you need help, there is a number to call, but you will be informed that they don't support the Blake anymore. I was on the hunt for an ethernet cable and randomly found an unplugged Wifi router under my nightstand. We invited others to come soak up our Wifi. Many people have noted that there is no breakfast offered. This is a huge confusion. The restaurant in the lobby, The Custom House, is not affiliated with the hotel, but yet there's a sign in the elevator which says you can get breakfast there. The Custom House isn't even open for breakfast! Anyway, I guess the structure changed when Ms. Hilton purchased the place and things still haven't been addressed with it. There was a convention in town when we got there and they had donuts and coffee for those folks on the second floor. Despite having over 30 rooms, we had no breakfast, so I'm guessing one of the convention folks set that up themselves. I heard many people ask the front desk about the breakfast and were told to go to Starbucks across the street, which is hilarious, given that Orange is around the corner and awesome. I even overheard one guy saying that when he booked with Expedia it specifically said "breakfast included", at which point the desk clerk got pissy with him and said Expedia was wrong. We all noted that the front desk staff are stressed out because things are so crazy and management simply seems to be avoiding the problems. The most frustrating thing about the front desk is, however, that they don't answer the phone! In fact, it seems that they avoid the phone altogether. Many people compared notes on calling from inside and outside the place just to see if they could get someone! Like I said though, I managed to get someone on the phone to give me hangers and they actually showed up. The upshot is that the bell men are nice and very attentive, but let's face it, they work on tips. The downer is that they don't have hotel umbrellas. So if it's raining in Chicago, and you ain't got, prepare to go buy one or catch cold. To sum up: This is a nice property in a good location which is rapidly falling apart due to owner neglect. For the amount of money they charge, you can do better. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Jackboy48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I found a reasonable internet rate for what was supposed to be a quality hotel, and the location was great for mt personal 5 day discovery tour of Chicago. Unfortunately I had such overwhelming problems during my stay, that I had to check out after 2 nights and find another hotel. My major issue was with the bathroom, which may have been partially designed to be handicapped accessable or was using the new concept of a "wet" room. Anyways it was all marble (synthetic?) with no lip around the shower area. There was a drain in the shower area as well as in the middle of the room, and I think the water was supposed to drain out in the shower area. Instead it spread accross the floor to the other drain and when I stepped out from the shower area, I immediately slipped and fell on my butt. When I contacted the Front Desk they had no concern about my fall and no understanding of my problem. Eventually they sent a housekeeper and I thought I would get some help cleaning up, but she could not speak English and appeared to be mad at me for all the water on the bathroom floor. I finally grabbed a bunch of towels from her cart and mopped up the mess myself. Later I asked if the drains had been cleared and if some shower mats had been placed in my room, but no one seemed to know about my problem. The next day I went out into the hallway and grabbed extra towels off one of the housekeeping carts so that I had a nice soggy floorcovering which was not slippery and was somewhat safer, if still unpleasant.. Then I was forced to go outside the hotel once again, on a cool and grey morning, to grab some breakfast at the local unfriendly diner because the hotel had no breakfast in spite of the posters in the elevator. I realized as I came back into the hotel, that the lobby had the same marble as the bath, and it struck me that with the possibilty of rain later that day, that I could probably slip and fall once again, as the floor was quite uneven. The prospect of another scary shower and scavaging for more towels, as well as the thought of going out again in bad weather to even get a cup of coffee, led me to check out immediately. I ended up at the Chicago Hilton, which also had a reasonable rate, and had functional bathrooms as well as food! In fact the location was even more ideal and I was quite impressed by their great service, as well as the great quality of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Bother!”
Reviews.Author: Smurfette021
Reviews.Content: This was THE worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my entire life. I was on a trip with a few friends from work during Chicago's WONDERFUL St. Patrick's Day festivies. However, the Hotel Blake put a major damper on one of the best times I had in Chicago. Note: We called the morning the day we were to check in to inform the hotel that we would be arriving very late. However, one of my co-workers had a confirmation number and they assured us that this was not a problem. WRONG! We had a group of 4 men and 3 women and booked enough rooms to accomidate for this. When we arrived at the hotel at approximately 11:00pm, we were informed that there were NO ROOMS AVAILABLE. We were all in disbelief that this could even happen! We told the woman helping us who we had spoken to, and she said that she had already left for the day. To say the least we were all furious! After about 1 hour of complaining they handed us 2 key cards. We ended up with 2 rooms each with only ONE KING SIZED BED!!! They did not offer to move us to a different room when available, but made us simply "make due" with what they had given us, or lose out on our money. A refund was out of the question to them. Not only did our rooms not accomidate us, but down the hall there was a MASSIVE water pool (perhaps from bathtub leakage above). The water remained there for the 3 nights we stayed there. Nobody ever came to clean it up, and the housekeeping attendance mearly "worked around it." They were very rude to us when we checked out, literally throwing our paper receipts to us. They said nothing about inconveniencing us, no apologies were made, no discounts were given. I found only 2 good things about this hotel: 1. The decor was very pretty 2. There's a Starbucks on the corner (but you could have that at just about any hotel in Chicago!!!) SIDE NOTE: Personally, my family is a stickler for things being AAA recommended -- this hotel was NOT! NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Blake”
Reviews.Author: DanAndNancy
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at a specific business hotel in Chicago, but, due to conventions in town, I had no choice but the Blake ($450/night!). For that price, my expections were not met. Problems encountered incuded: 1. Grime on window frames discovered (on hands) when I had to shut a window that had been left open. Other areas in the room (e.g., closet) were also not clean. 2. Wireless internet connection did not work. When I called the "877" number for tech support as indicated, I was told that the tech support service no longer has a service contract with the hotel. I used the ethernet connection on the modem, which was on the nightstand - not the desk! 3. While signs in the elevators noted that breakfast was served in the restaurant associated with the hotel, it was, in fact, not open for breakfast. 4. Room was on second floor overlooking alley behind the hotel. Garbage service and deliveries late at night and early in the morning were quite noisy. 5. For a property that has been open for about a year, there appearred to be general maintenance issues. For example, the curtain hangers were loose; base moldings were broken and crown moldings had separated. 6. When I checked out, I asked for a check-out statement. I was told that, since I had no incidental charges (room was booked and paid for through hotels.com), such a statement was not available. Based upon the issues noted above, the Blake will be near the bottom, if not off the list, of my choice of hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience-Don't be fooled by pretty pictures!”
Reviews.Author: KingKim
Reviews.Content: Save yourself the agony! Hotel Blake in Chicago looks like an upscale modern hotel with all the up-to-date stylings and amenities any traveler could want. If your planning a trip to Chicago don't step one foot near this disheveled mess. As soon as we walked off the elevator we had a problem; the smell of an unidentified object lingered throughout the hallway for three days. Our room was missing a light bulb (that we still have yet to receive) our poor toilet paper dispenser looked as if it was ripped out of the wall and the sound of a jack hammer was coming through our vent. To make matters worse no one answers the phone! I have complained to several people (when they finally did answer) and a manager has yet to rectify the situation or let alone call me back. Oh and that great restaurant that pops up on the first page also doesn't exist. I guess that's just there for show. Spend the extra money and go to the "W" - It'll be money well spent. If you see this place RUN FAST!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach199
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Blake for 4 nights and had a fantastic time, the staff were really friendly and helpful, the room was immaculate and the bed so, so comfy! We were not aware of any street noise (as mentioned in previous reviews) and the hotel is in a great location. Would recommend this hotel to any one!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of The Blake!”
Reviews.Author: carusdeb
Reviews.Content: Seven of us arrived at the Blake for a three day stay. Even though we confirmed reservations three days prior to our stay when we arrived they would not give us rooms. They indicated that they overbooked by thirty people! The hotel they wanted to send us to was next to a landfill! They claimed it was only 20min from downtown Chicago.. maybe 20 min without traffic considerations! The hotel manager would not come out of the office to talk to us.. and did not return any calls by our travel agent. We were promised rooms two days later and again they didn't have any. While waiting they told us that everyone else who was to come in that day was also going to be refused a room... Ten minutes later a man came in and they registered him. When I questioned it, they told me it was difficult to explain.. I've traveled in my job for 20 years.. I've never been so inconvenience before.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel In Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BeBackLater
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel when looking for 6 rooms while attending a conference. We were a little late booking, but they still had very favorable rates. I was very pleased with the service at the hotel as they accomodated both special packages arriving and special room requests without hesitation. It is within walking distance of everything you want to see in Chicago and it's easy to get to from the L. My only complaint was that the rooms needed a second light on the same side of the bed as the alarm clock. It was a little dark working at night with just the hall light and one bed side light. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travel0city
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend, early October 2007. The hotel had a special offer (5th night free) that made it an easy choice, compared to hotels of similar price or quality. The 3.5 star is underrated in my opinion, this hotel has nearly everything a 5 star hotel has as well. Only downside was the breakfast - there was none. But enough places to have breakfast just around the corner. Location is good, a bit south of the centre but still downtown. 2 subway stations nearby. If not for the special rate, you could maybe find a same price/quality hotel within the loop or the magnificent mile but for this trip, I couldn't have wished for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “stole our money, didn't follow up”
Reviews.Author: vacationlisa
Reviews.Content: Four 30-something girls traveled to Chicago for a concert and stayed here because of location. Things were fine until we stopped for gas on the way home. We pooled gas money and put the extra in the console. We valeted the car and enjoyed the concert. The next day, halfway home, we stopped for gas. Our money was gone. We should not have left it there - we just forgot about it. It was around $50. I immediately called the hotel, I spoke to the Valet Manager. He said he would see who was working the previous night, investigate and get back to me. Of course he never did and my calls went unreturned. We'll not be back. The hotel itself was fine. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabub
Reviews.Content: I had a comfortable stay. I arrived late and my room was waiting for me. Unfortunately, it was a room where the door had been removed from the bathroom and it was next to the elevator lobby and for some reason the hotel has overly loud almost rap-like music playing in the elevator lobbies 24-hours a day. I could hear it in my room and even though it was 1:00 a.m., I thought it would keep me awake. I called the desk and the gentleman who had just checked me in had no problem moving me to another larger available room because of these problems. I actually preferred the first room, though because instead of two beds it had a nice comfy chair. Second Room was missing the toilet paper dispenser. View from the first room was of the nearby landmark library and from the second was the Sears Tower. Bathrooms were large with rain showerheads. Beds were extremely comfortable. There was a stain on the duvet that resembled blood. I mentioned it to the housekeeper and she replaced it when she cleaned my room. It was over 100 degrees when I was there and the hotel's AC worked fine. One thing I would suggest to improve the room would be to add a mini-frig. Location of the hotel was good. I had no trouble walking to the attractions I wanted to see, but it is definitely not in the center of the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Krugrose
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at Hotel Blake for my friends through Expedia website. The charge was on my credit card. However three days after my friend left Hotel Blake, he found his credit card was also charged with same amount. Nobody contacted him or me for this mistake which cost him around extra $600 USD. My friend and I went to Hotel Blake receiption for explanation, the staff was soooo rude and impatient. His name is Chris. He made the mistake and even teased us by saying: Wow, you really need this $600 dollars, poor you! We got really angry. I tried to talk with Hotel Blake's manager, but they were helpless. They asked me to deal with Chris only because it was him who did this mistake. My friend and I were really really disappointed. We will NEVER book Hotel Blake again! Wish all travelers to be careful of your bills when checking out!!

Reviews.Title: “could be great but isnt yet”
Reviews.Author: roudland
Reviews.Content: We had high expections for the Blake - some of them were met - the rooms and decor were stylish, attractive, comfortable - definitely well above average and I liked the nabe, but there were disappointing lapses. It seems to me the Blake is trying to deliver the amenities of an upscale chain but to also provide an individual flavor. The attractive individual flavor and comfort were there but there were annoying issues in maintenance and staff training , which I guess might have been dealt with in a chain hotel. Im thinking of a broken AC fan, which made a noise like a jet - we had to call the desk to figure out how to turn it off, a leaky faucet in the bathroom that left a pool of water on the lovely stone vanity, veneer damage that had not been repaired on the attractive furniture and a missing pull in our son's room, towells that were not replenished, WIFI down in the rooms, and some staff that were, to my taste, inappropriately informal in behavior. Others might have liked that last. I hope the Blake has been able to address some of these.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: kygirl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for Labor Day weekend. We love music and architecture and have been wanting to go for a long time. Many of the hotels I tried to book downtown were super expensive. I ran across Hotel Blake on Priceline and then called the hotel to book a room. The listing price on the website was 499.00 a night but w/ my AAA rate it was 151.00 a night. I was hooked! Looking at photos of the hotel doesn't do justice. This boutique hotel is very modern and chic. The wood is a dark stained wood throughout the hotel and the lobby is gorgeous. We checked in around 3pm and the help was very nice and informative. Check in did take a little extra time as they only had me staying one night, when I reserved two nights. I showed them my reservation confirmation and it was fixed (another reason I ALWAYS print it out). We went up to the room and was very happy. It was beautiful and very modern w/ tall ceilings. The bathroom was a bit small. There is no shower curtain..just a small piece of glass that is decorated like many foreign hotels. The bed was super soft and nice! Had a high thread sheet count and feather down comforter and pillows. All in all we were very happy, especially with the location being right near the Loop. I would definitely stay here again as it was in my price range and everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: cari25bb
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I stayed at the Blake for 2 nights while we were attending a class downtown. We really enjoyed our stay at the Blake. The rooms were a very nice size for a downtown hotel, and the bathroom was huge! The beds had high thread count sheets and very comfy duvets, and the room had a very modern, chic decor. We didn't use the workout room at all, but it looked very clean, with a lot of newer equipment.

Reviews.Title: “extremely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mops1
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the Blake and will be going back. We got to Chicago in the morning and since our room was available, we got to check in several hours before the normal time. Our room was on the first floor facing the front (Dearborn). There was some noise from the street but not enough to bother us. In fact, it was nice to look out the window and see the activity on the street. Everything in the room worked perfectly and the room was clean. The personnel were very helpful and courteous. We did not eat at the Custom House because it is fairly expensive, but you are not far from other restaurants and don't miss Orange around the corner for breakfast or lunch. Since this is a small hotel, it also felt safe and secure and I enjoyed staying somewhere besides the Magnificent Mile, yet being close to everything. I will certainly be back to the Hotel Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ProfessionalTravel7
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after a wedding reception. Excellent service and amenities. Highly recommended. The mattresses are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: blondboca
Reviews.Content: Location was great for me, as my son lives around the corner! Nice little neighborhood area, lots of pubs, restaurants, theatre district nearby. I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews, and our initial reception wasn't very friendly, as we waited for over 30 minutes for valet parking. Couldn't seem to get anyone's attention to leave the car. But adter that, it was a very nice experience and I will stay there again. Concierges were super, room was lovely and well-appointed. Only complaint about room was the feather pillows- I don't like them, asked for firmer pillow, but the maid brought more puffly pillows. Bring your own if you like a firmer one! But the bed was very firm, super comfortable. Cool-lloking lobby, friendly staff, good value for the price. I'll stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: ChandlerStyles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is my favorite hotel! Best stay I ever had! Great service! I will definitely check out Custom House Restaurant (inside the Blake) when I come back to Chicago. I heard they won several awards and are one of the top restaurants in the city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: afecher
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Hotel Blake this afternoon and so far I have been thrilled with the experience. It has been absolutely wonderful. Our King room is large with three huge windows allowing lots of light to float into the room. The bathroom is expansive with granite countertops and double sinks. The room is very chic with crown molding, high ceilings, and cool decor. There is a business center available 24/7 as is the clean, expansive fitness center. The hotel is situated near everything. I'm so happy that I chose Hotel Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, but slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: goldigboy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Blake for a conference in downtown Chicago. The hotel's location is great...everything is accessible. The rate was quite high, but this was typical of all hotels during this period--several conferences at the same time. The hotel itself was chic, albeit quite dark overall. The lobby was not terribly comfortable or inviting. A major disappointment was the lack of any high speed internet access in our room--it was down for repairs for an entire week, which I found unacceptable. They did have one computer and one ethernet cable in the business center, but I always had to wait to use either connection. On the plus side, use of the printer in the business center was free for guests. Also, I was completely unable to get Verizon wireless service in my 6th floor room...I had to go out to the sidewalk to make any calls. The mattresses were comfortable, but the linens were not the quality you would expect from this level of hotel. The bathroom, however, was exquisite--very large, with two sinks set into a large marble vanity, and a wonderful, elegant shower (no tub, if that's something you're looking for). The complementary toiletries were also quite nice--lotion, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and large bars or soap, all from Bed Bath and Beyond. The view from my room (and most, I gather) was horrible--the worn stone side of the neighboring building. The hotel is shorter than the surrounding buildings, and is flanked on all sides, diminishing the views.
