Finally, the hallways echoed horribly and the doors seemed to slam constantly, causing me to wake up several nights at around 2 or 3 AM. If you're looking for a chic hotel that is all about image, go for Hotel Blake, but don't expect to be terribly comfortable, except when you're taking a shower!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixie15
Reviews.Content: We booked a Thurs. to Sat. stay at Hotel Blake and got a very good rate of $149/night through their website. All in all we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is on a busy street, and convenient walking distance to Grant Park, Michigan Ave., etc. The dÃ©cor is trendy boutique, and the rooms are very spacious. We had a king room, with a fold-out sofa bed. A few pros and cons: Cons: We were on the 5th floor, and heard a lot of traffic noise on S. Dearborn St. every night. Iâ€™d suggest requesting a higher floor. Our main door (room 506) didnâ€™t close all the way, and we had to pull it shut when coming & going. There werenâ€™t many towels in our king room, however the housekeeper readily supplied us with more towels. The toilet flush was extremely loud & foreceful. We couldn't adjust the room temperature adequately, it was either too warm or too cold. A few light bulbs were missing in the lamps. Pros: Great location in the South Loop, walkable to Grant Park, Millenium Park, the Library, and the Art Institute of Chicago, etc. Very nice dÃ©cor in the lobby and rooms, cool music was piped in by the elevators. Front desk personnel were very friendly & helpful, especially Jesse the doorman. The fitness room was spacious, and the equipment up-to-date. There was free internet access in the lobby. Our bathroom had a long counter with 2 sinks, and a large rainfall showerhead. We didnâ€™t eat at the in-house restaurant Custom House, nor did we order room service (both were rather pricey) but Edwardoâ€™s across the street was reasonably-priced & good, and there is a Potbelly Sandwich shop next door, as well as a Starbucks on the corner. All in all a very good hotel. We will be staying there again next month.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for art institute and symphony”
Reviews.Author: tennismom3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blake for two nights. The Magnificent Mile area is a better location for shopping and restaurants, but we were in Chicago for the symphony, so the location was great for us - only about a ten minute walk. Definitely try the restaurant "Orange" for breakfast, just around the corner from the Blake. Huge selection of breakfasts and fresh juices in a fun, casual atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was the magazine they had in the room. On the cover was a stripper and the magazine was about where to go for nightlife. Guess they are aiming for a clientele other than families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at The Blake”
Reviews.Author: lala0310
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a business trip to Chicago and my boss made my hotel arrangements at the Hotel Blake. After reading all the reviews here at Tripadvisor (good and bad) I really had no expectations. I was pleasantly surprised! GASP! Here is the low down: Prior to arrival I had called the Hotel Blake to get a reccomendation of a car service to pick me up at the airport. Alison at the front desk was professional and effecient. She took care of all my arrangements. Once I arrived at the Hotel Blake, there was no doorman. This didn't bother me, I am just relaying it to those who may care about such things. The front desk staff was friendly and checked me in quickly. My king room, #902, was lovely. The bed was comfortable. I loved the rainhead shower. Though, once you stepped away from the shower head you could get a little chilly. The bathroom did need a fan to help with the steam everywhere. There was no tv or phone in the bathroom as it states on the room description. No big deal there either. I encounter one problem in that my safe was locked closed when I arrived, I called the front desk and said I would need it fixed. I was told Maintenace was on their way up. I proceded to finish packing and still no maintenance. I had to meet some clients in the bar downstairs and could no longer wait so I called the front desk, told them to cancel the request for right now and that I'll call again in the morning. I put the "Do Not Disturb" sign out and headed to Custom House (more on Custom House in a moment). I returned to my room, a few hours later to find that the safe was open. Maintenance had still come up to my room and entered with the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. This did not please me. I called the front desk, they rapidly took the complaint and apologized. I then received a call from the Manager apologizing for the mix up. I can understand why some folks have a problem with Housekeeping. I knew going in, after reading the reviews here, that I should call and make sure I have my room cleaned first thing in the morning. The first morning there I forgot to take my own advice! LOL I left my room around 9am and returned around 4pm only to find it still not cleaned. ARGH! Housekeeping then knocked on my door a moment later and then cleaned the room. The next morning I called and requested Housekeeping to come early, problem solved. The hotel was sold out but I never lacked for an elevator. Front desk always there, helpful and friendly. The doormen were there sporaticly. Custom House was very nice. I enjoyed cocktails there on two nights. Apetizers the first. There are some great dining options within walking distance of the hotel. Orange for breakfast, Hackney's for lunch or dinner. You'll see folks walking their dogs and some restaurant patios are dog friendly. I would stay at the Hotel Blake again. Do what I did, learn from these reviews and be proactive, ie: call when leaving for housekeeping to come up ASAP. I'd give the Hotel Blake 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Blech Hotel - luxury? I think not”
Reviews.Author: BOBDNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blake hotel for three days this month. Having stayed many times in Chicago, I wanted to try a different hotel (usually stay at the Sofitel or the W). Chicago was pretty booked that week so the reviews from the Blake were reassuring and wereally looked forward to the trip. Well, so much for truth in advertising. Where to begin? The service can't be faulted as there wasn't any. Their website talks of a choice of daily newspapers. Your choice is USA Today (or as we refer to it - McNews). But the best partt was, after seeing no paper outside our door, I went downstairs and was told I'd have to pick it up from the front desk. I requested that it be delivered and the dead-eyed receptionist just shrugged and walked away. The next day, a zombie who relieved the dead-eyed guard told me they could get me a newspaper if I wanted one. This was as I had one from the Starbucks across the street under my arm. I requested one for the next day. Never received one unsurprisingly. Three requests to have the room cleaned were met with a very kurt "well the next shift will be there soon - there's a convention in town". Every time the room was "serviced" there was of course something missing - no coffee or too few towels, etc. We alerted the rather annoyed front desk manager that there had been a room service tray in our hallway for over 8 hours and it was finally removed. 2 hours later. The room itself was not what we booked. When I booked it I expected one of the suites listed on their website. They have no suites I was told when I checked in. The rate was exorbitant for the size room we received. In response I got one of their patented shrugs. I asked to speak with the manager. She shrugged again and said she wasn't sure when he'd get there. "He drops in". The best part of this stay were the doormen who seemed genuinely embarrassed by the lack of services. That was when there was a doorman. It looks like they're cutting back on services as teice we arrived at night and there was no one to be found in the lobby. No doorman, no desk service. At one point we sat there just to see how long it would take to have someone show up. After a half an hour the novelty wore off. If anyone's in the market for some white vases, stop by the Blake after 10 and they're yours for the taking. Anyone in the market for good service and good value, steer clear of this two star rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake -- Great Hotel, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: madderfish
Reviews.Content: Don't let the earlier review saying the area is dicey sway you. It is in the middle of downtown Chicago, which is a big city. If you're not used to being in a city, everywhere will seem dicey if you stay there more than a couple of hours. I lived in the area for years and it was just listed as the hottest new neighborhood in Chicago. It's far more residential than the loop, so you'll see people with baby carriages and their dogs on a Saturday, which isn't something you'll see further north. It's off the beaten path a bit, which is a big plus for me because I don't have to fight a crowd of 800 people when I walk out the door. It's quick walking distance from Grant Park (and the nicest hotel you'll find anwhere near Grant Park, I'd argue) This hotel is an excellent boutique hotel. It is a boutique hotel though, so don't expect the type of stay you'd get at a holiday inn or a "corporate hotel". It's modern, which means it has an open shower (yes that part is true), but that has a rain head shower head. If you know how to use it, you'll appreciate the luxury of it. If you're a "splasher" you will definately get water in the room, so it may not be for you. There are no muffins or pastries, but I'd definately recommend Orange for breakfast which is just around the corner. Plus there are three or four lovely brunch places within walking distance. Chicago is a walking city, so keep in mind that if you stay here, you're best bet is probably to walk everywhere. I'd highly recommend the Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ 413”
Reviews.Author: alex098
Reviews.Content: Before I travel to Chicago I was really scare about what I read on some web pages about the bad time they have. I have to say it was a really nice experience and I can recommend to everyone goes to Chicago stays there, they didnâ€™t say but metro station is just two blocks and also all busses stops are really close. My room 413 was an exceptional room, I slept like a baby!!! All was clean and was OK. My only complains are only about food menu in morning during breakfast and add more TV channels. I have pics of my room and, you can e-mail me if you have any doubt @ hara_45040@yahoo.com. Nice place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rossr1961
Reviews.Content: For the money we spent, we were greatly disappointed. The king sized bed is really two single beds. The shower is designed so that there is no enclosure, thereby getting the floor wet easily. The floors were marble without mats, thus making the wet bathroom floor dangerous. Worse part of all, there is no separate heat and a/c control. Like my old cheap appartment, the management decides when to put the heat or a/c on. We were chiilly at night Instead of being in front of the bed, the TV was set off to the side of the room. The room dimensions are odd. Other than the above mentioned disappointments, the ammenities resembled a nice 3 star hotel. The staff are friendly and the location is ideal. For the money we expected a luxury hotel. I

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but terrible high-speed internet connection.”
Reviews.Author: speciestart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Blake for two nights during a visit to Chicago last month. Overall, the place was very nice. Our room was very large with a very large bathroom. There was ample space to sit and relax, and the down bedding on the king-size bed was wonderful. However, one of the main reasons for booking here was the "complimentary high speed internet" which is necessary for my boyfriend and I when traveling as he is an editor and works from home. The internet connection was very slow and disconnected every couple of seconds, making it impossible to get any work done. We called for assistance and they said they would have the problem remidied within a few hours, but that never happened. Also, parking for this hotel was $39 per day. There is a public parking structure right down the street (a very easy walk) that offers overnight parking for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Of_Diamonds
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, and the surrounding area is a bit dicey, as we found out. I suggest you find something cheaper, cleaner and safer by looking a couple of blocks north. Also, the air filter in the rooms was filthy and they don't serve coffee or muffins (which I missed). Only highlight was the Custom House restaurant, but I would never stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Metallo
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at the hotel from March 9th till 17th. Once we got at the reception, the lady saw that we were going to stay for 8 nights and she said: "You are going to stay long with us, therefore I will give you one of our nicest rooms". That was indeed true. The room was big, very clean with well known optionals, like iPOD station and wireless included. The staff is very friendly and helpfull, we asked for information on a grill & bar at walking distance and they did recommend a good one called "Blackies", 5 min. walk. One day, we wanted to print something, we asked at the receptionist for possibilities and he told us we could use their "business center" in the lobby, there is a PC and a printer, we could print whatever we needed to and for free! Location is very good, Blue and Red Lines are 3 min. walk. I may sound too enthusiastic guys, but I have been visiting hundreds of hotels in my life, including 5 stars, none of them offered the service and kindness of Blake hotel. Hotel Blake rules! Enjoy your staying.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jpbb
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise. I had booked this hotel through [----] with a bit of apprehension given some of the reviews but got a good price and decided to chance it. I'm glad I did. The hotel is conveniently located :2 blks from the Blue Line, 2 blocks from the Red Line, and 2 blocks from the elevated loop trains. It was easy to get to from O'Hare, and we never had to take a cab anywhere we wanted to go. It's located across from the Public Library (the gargoyles on the roof of the library made it easy to re-orient yourself when you got off the subway) near the Publisher Row section of Downtown in a failry quiet area. There is not a lot of restaurants or clubs in the area but you can easily head to other parts of the loop to find what you want. The room was large compared to most Chicago hotels, nicely decorated with a WONDERFULLY comfortable bed! The marble bathroom was large with a large step in shower with great water pressure, hot water, and a "rain shower " shower head, so I didn't miss not having a tub at all. The free wireless internet was a plus. If there was one thing that kept this hotel from being perfect it was that housekeeping did not do our room until late in the afternoon. The room was immaculate as was the bathroom both upon arrival and throughout our stay. We did not eat at the Custom House (the restaurant on-site) but saw a lot of locals coming and going at dinner time, which I take as an endorsement. The pizza restaurant across the street is good, and we also stumbled upon the Plymouth Restaurant 2 blooks away. It's casual, not much to look at but with great prices, large and varied menu, and good food and open for breakfast through dinner. My steak dinner with fresh steamed veggies, baked potato and greek salad was $15! After having stayed at the W, the Chicago Hitlon, The Swissotel, and Hotel Allegro this is now at the top of our list. The front desk staff was professional, no problems with elebators, our room was on the 4th floor and quiet other than the customary morning traffic noise you'd expect to hear in a downtown hotel in a city of this size. The Hotel Blake has now moved to the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffnjanl
Reviews.Content: The directions to the hotel were wrong. When we did arrive there the hotel looked nice. We were on the 5th floor. The hallway stunk like mildew. We got to our room which looked nice at first. There was a hole in our wall, and the down filled matress cover, (which will doubles as your only comforter/blanket,) had body fluid stains all over. I can not express how badly it needed cleaned, and obviously, it isn't cleaned often. The seriously dissappointing part was for two mornings in a row we were not able to shower. On the first morning, my birthday, the front desk informed us they were experiencing boiler issues . They told us we would have to wait at least 2 hours for hot water. We made the best of the circumstances and went to the Sears tower unbathed. The hot water worked that afternoon. The next morning we had no hot water again. At that time, we were told to wait a half an hour until the water heated up. We did, and still had no hot water. We got tired of waiting and left for home with no shower again. If you expect no morning shower or appoligies from the front desk, go to Hotel Blake. If not, choose somewhere else!! We never recieved any compensation for the hassel, not even the phone call we were promised from the "boss" who handles complaints. Convieniently, that "boss" doesn't work weekends, so all weekend complaints are not dealt with until Monday. As for the restaurant, we spent $40.00 on two cheese omelets, two cups of coffee, and two orders of whole wheat toast. Very fancy, and not so very good. Not reccommending the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag--Good Value”
Reviews.Author: geebo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Blake on business with five co-workers. We paid $119 per night, and at that price itâ€™s a good value. The rooms are a mixed bag. My room was fine: clean and nicely decorated. Others complained about the room being too small or the room being too hot (HVAC not working). The closet is tiny, and there are no dressers in the rooms. That bugged some, but it was, again, fine with me (I was only staying two nights). The bathroom is clean and modern. The shower is a big plus, especially for a downtown hotel: huge sunflower showerhead and plenty of hot water and water pressure. The human element in the hotel was another mixed bag. One of our party asked the front desk clerk if he could get change for $20, and was told simply, â€œNo.â€� In the morning, we asked for a couple of cabs, and the front desk staff looked at us like we had asked for a spaceship. They did not offer to call or hail one for us. Their idea of help was informing us that it would be tough to find a cab in the morning (7:00AM). It took us about 30 seconds to flag the first one down on the street by ourselves. Other experiences were fine. If you are looking for a clean, no-frills hotel and can get a rate around $119, you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blake amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: exclusiv
Reviews.Content: Got a killer deal with their February promotion of $129/night. Was a little concerned with some of the previous reviews about noise and such, but they appear to be corrected as my stay was relaxing. The room was spacious, the king sized bed was extremely comfortable, the ipod docking was a nice bonus, and the walk-in-shower even had the same Grohe Rainshower head that I have at home! The Custom House restaurant which is attached to the hotel is a little pricey but I highly recommend it. Great location and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Whow!! What a great place for $100”
Reviews.Author: gtd068a
Reviews.Content: All i can say is whow!! for $100 we got a great room on the 11th floor. spacious room, great location - 10 minute walk to the fountain/millinium park, 10 minute walk to the Chicago theatre. We were able to find car parking on the same block for $20 with one in and out. The train station was 5 minutes away. The bed and bed sheets were absolutely awesome in comfort and feel. Bathroom was very spacious with double sinks and very relaxing shower. The iPOD docking station was great touch, TV was high quality, internet connection was available but we did not utilize it. The room was spacious and definelty felt 4/5 starish. We could not hear any noise from neighbours, although we knew they were little loud when we ran into them in the lobby and hallway. I loved the quietness because i am a very light sleeper. Me and my wife LOVED our stay and we will definetly stay again! The only drawback was very slow elevators and curtains could have been little darker so no sun shine would creep in in the morning but still a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dwilli10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Blake over Thanksgiving. We got an excellent rate through Expedia (very inexpensive for downtown Chicago, but I'm sure the holiday had something to do with that). The bed was very comfy, with a down comforter and down pillows. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was huge. There were two sinks so my husband and I were not competing for sink time and the shower was huge with one of those large showerheads that simulate rainfall. The finishes in the room were very nice...it definately made you feel you were staying in something unique as opposed to the chain hotel. There were a couple of parking garages very close by if you wanted to avoid the ridiculous charge for valet parking and a neat, little breakfast place right around the corner (called "Orange"). The only nitpick is that the windows did not want to close completely so we had a bit of extra city noise that we could have done without. But, in short, I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Blake is just OK”
Reviews.Author: baxterstravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Blake last weekend (11/17-11/20). We selected the Blake based on pictures and reviews, also the price for the trip was incredible- $565 for 2 including rd trip air from Phila. Well the Blake is in a bit remote part of town, not a lot to do in the immediate area. However, the theater district is just a few blocks away as in the Sears tower, and millenium park. Restuarants are a bit further-- at least the good ones:) Anyway, the staff at the Blake are very friendly and accomodating, but they do not have a traditonal concierge service. No one offered to book anything for us, but they did politely hand us a map and direct us where to go to book things ourselves. The lobby is georgeous!! The rooms are a bit small, but nicely decorated. However, the bathroom looked like a motel. The paint on the ceiling was peeling in big chips and just hanging there. The room needed a bit more attention to detail. Small stains on the carpet, the TV channel guide was completely wrong, and it had very few channels. I am sure my hubby and I could have switched to a different room, but we were too tired the night we arrived and too busy while we were there to care. I don't think I would stay at the Blake again, unless we got another incredible deal...then maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Blake Perfect for Exploring Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dgibbs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to big cities like Chicago for one thing: to walk to as many interesting eating, drinking, shopping, and entertainment destinations as possible. Therefore, hotel location is absolutely critical but we have no interest in spending so much money on a room that we feel the need to hang out there instead of enjoying what the city has to offer! That being said, the Hotel Blake was the PERFECT choice for us. We found an Expedia deal for $139 and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The lobby and restaurant were very elegant and hip (although we didn't eat there). The room was clean and modern, the king bed was incredibly comfy, and the huge shower head was delightful. Oh, and the staff was friendly and professional. All that, and the ideal location for exploring Chicago by foot or subway. We truly couldn't have asked for anything more. Even if we had paid the regular price of $159, it still would have been a great deal compared to most other boutique hotels in the area that are closer to $300 a night. We will definitely stay at the Blake again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Besy USA hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: howick30
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through Expedia particularly as I was travelling alone - usually expensive for hotels. Easy to find (subway from O'Hare) and great for getting around the city - Red and Blue Line Subway stations nearby but walking was no problem to most places I wanted to see. Hotel staff were very helpful, room kept spotless and tidy, quiet location with lots of hot water available. Internet availability was useful. I would return there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Marathon Location”
Reviews.Author: AA55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Blake for three nights. The location is perfect. The hotel is only a five minute walk to Grant Park (the marathon start). Our room was clean, quiet, and we had a cool view of the Sears Tower and Stock Exchange. The front desk/lobby service was average. The cleaning staff was friendly. The free internet access was helpful. Check in/check out was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive”
Reviews.Author: routeboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago to run the marathon on October 22nd. We had initially booked at the Blake back in January with some trepidation because the hotel was undergoing renovations and the reviews were not very good. However we got a good rate so stayed with it and are glad we did. The renovation is complete and it is generally quite pleasing. It is very much in the "boutique hotel" style, so if this isn't your style, look elsewhere. I suspect that the degree of satisfaction one has will depend on what room you are in. Initially we were given a room on the 7th floor facing the street. All good, except that it was so narrow that there was no room for a chest of drawers of any kind. Also, a small closet. Maybe not an issue if you are travelling alone, or just staying for one night and don't mind leaving your clothes in the suitcase. When we asked to be moved we were told that there are several different room configurations on each floor. However, the front desk staff were very happy to accomade our needs so we were moved to a bigger room, but on the back side of the building. Note that all of the odd number rooms are on the back side and look out at a brick wall that is only a very narrow street (more like a laneway) away, maybe 25 feet. Not an issue for us, since we don't stay in city hotels for the view. However what was a big issue is that the garbage bins for the hotel and other businesses are in this laneway, and the garbage trucks came by every night at about 4 AM. Ridiculous! We were awakened to the sound of these trucks compacting garbage in the middle of the night. Perhaps this would not be so noticable on a higher floor; we were on the 2nd. We again asked to be moved the next day but were told this was not possible because the hotel was sold out. Hmmmm. On a positive note, the room was clean and well appointed, the bed was fantastically comfortable, and the maid service great. However, the rooms do NOT have bathtubs, which would have been very nice for soaking in after running a marathon. But the shower is really big, and marble tiled. As noted in an earlier review, traffic noice could be an issue for some. Congress Parkway, at the north end of the hotel, is a VERY busy 8 lane street. Ideally one would want a big room on an upper floor, and at the south end of the building. Our friends had such a room, and if we had been there I would be giving The Blake a 5 star review. Didn't use the fitness centre or go to the restaurant, but both looked very nice and the restaurant was busy, a good sign. Other positives are the friendly and helpful staff and the location, which is 3 blocks from Michigan Avenue and Grant Park. Also the nearest CTA subway station (LaSalle) is only about a 3 minute walk. This is the Blue line, which is the train that goes to O'Hare Airport. The Plymouth Restaurant, which is about a 5 minute walk, serves "casual American", including breakfast and has a sports bar downstairs, as well as a rooftop bar (not that it was open in late October). Overall, I would consider staying at the Blake again, but given that the rates have increased (depending on when you stay), the value for money quotient has gone down.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Blake: A "Must Stay"”
Reviews.Author: rebecca1027
Reviews.Content: STAY AT THE HOTEL BLAKE!! This was my husband and my second trip to Chicago. During our first visit, we stayed at the "renowned" (says who?) Whitehall Hotelâ€¦which totally sucked!!! Our experience at the Whitehall was so bad we were terrified that any hotel that received fewer than four stars had to be unbearable. However, our stay at The Hotel Blake proved the star-system wrong. To be honest, we were a little apprehensive about staying at the Blake after reading some of the poor reviews. Plus, the low price and the name (perhaps a knock-off of "The Drake Hotel"?) made us wonder what kind of bad imposter The Hotel Blake might be. We worried for nothing though--everything was perfect! For starters, we couldn't have asked for a better location. The Blake was a few blocks from the Theater District, a short walk to the Chicago Institute of Arts, a $4 cab ride from the train station and within walking distance of tons of shopping, restaurants, etc. The hotel was immaculate too (trust meâ€¦I'm extremely picky). From the modern, stylish dÃ©cor, to the outstanding staff and service, everything about the Blake was top-notch. Ohâ€¦and the shower is fit for a queen (or king)â€¦and big enough to fit both! However, as some of the other reviews mentioned, the Blake did not have flat panel TVs. Where they got that idea, I have no clueâ€¦but who goes to Chicago to watch TV anyway? We weren't disappointed. Without a doubt, we'll be staying at the Blake again and we highly recommend you do the same. PS: After making your reservations on hotels.com or another travel website, be sure to call the hotel to confirm your reservations, bed-size, etc. (Tip: While you have them on the phone, ask for the biggest/nicest room too.) If you don't do this (like one guest we encountered as we were checking out), there's a chance the Blake will not be able to accommodate your initial reservation, since reservations made online donâ€™t always reflect hotel availability. This is NOT the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but I've stayed in better......”
Reviews.Author: mowens
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews on Hotel Blake, I was a little hesitant to book here. I was in town on business and needed to be in this area. The hotel itself is obviously very old which can play either way for people. I didn't mind the age, it made it kind of chic really. Our room was on the 7th floor and wasn't too bad. There were a few spots where the wall paper was peeling off the wall near the floor, but hey, it's just cosmetics. The room was very clean. I have no complaints about that. The marble floors in the bathroom were a little dangerous when wet so be VERY careful. The room was quite large with high ceilings and the street facing wall was all windows. This had it's ups and downs. The draft off the glass was quite chilly. I know this is just the nature of big old buildings with lots of glass.....drafty. The biggest complaint I had was the noise off of the street. You are directly above Dearborn and Congress which can be quite busy at all hours. I'm certain you'd suffer this in most locations in the city, but I have stayed at other downtown locations in Chicago right on Michigan and did not experience the street noise I experienced at Hotel Blake. The next little issue was with the valet parking. I realize that there aren't a lot of options to park downtown so I can't complain about the $36/day valet parking charge. I would complain, however, about the fact that the first night we arrived they never parked the car, but left it on the curb all night in front of the hotel and tried to charge us the $36 anyway........ The other minor complaint would be the funky smell in the hallway. Our room didn't smell, but the hallway was very musty and had almost a leaking "propane" sort of smell. The staff was friendly and accomodating....no issues there. In summary, if you have to stay in the financial district, you could stay here without suffering too badly, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I would probably stay here again in a pinch, but not really by choice. One thing I will say, is if you do stay here, be sure to eat at Edwardo's across the street. EXCELLENT pizza and great service. A really nice little place.....

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: KAMack
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned for a weekend stay in Chicago at the Hotel Blake. We originally were going to stay at the W City Center but due to a last minute deal on Expedia, and positive things I read about Hotel Blake, we decided to stay at this new boutique hotel. I heard there were some kinks initally but that they had been worked out. Unfortunately, this was not true and we were very disappointed in the lack of customer service and attention to detail that most boutique hotels, especially those in the Preferred Boutique group, usually have. First, what you might read about this "luxury boutique hotel" on Expedia and it's Web site is false advertising. While the hotel looks nice from the outside and is located in a great area, there are none of the luxuries they promote (i.e., plama screen TVs, TVs in bathroom, robes, Molton Brown products, morning paper etc.). And, the customer service was awful - they made us feel like we were constantly putting them out any time we asked for something. When we arrived, our rooms were very warm as the air conditioning wasn't working and the windows did not open. The staff offered to provide us with another room but it was the same situation. They did not have fans or anything - basically they told us to tough it out. Also, I tried to talk with the manager several times during our stay but he was never on duty. I could go on and on...So, if you are looking for a luxury boutique hotel get away spend a little extra and stay at The James or W on Lakeshore as Hotel Blake still needs A LOT of work and some customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Celebrate Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: veronica22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary in the city and the location was great! close to michigan ave shopping. the rooms were spotless and the amenities were fabulous. It also had one of the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in!! A+ stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, very convenient to Board of Trade”
Reviews.Author: lawhelp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Blake during two separate business trips to Chicago. Each visit was made even better by the friendly staff who always greeted me by name and went above and beyond by anticipating my needs while there. As a business woman working at the Board of Trade I found the location of Hotel Blake to be incredibly convenient as well. I look forward to returning to Hotel Blake very soon. I'm very fortunate my travel agent found such a gem for my hotel accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Blake”
Reviews.Author: HootHoot
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Blake was great! My wife & I stayed there because of a recommendation from a friend. We had a romantic evening for the two of us and we didn't even have to leave the hotel. The hotel staff was very courteous & helpful. The concierge even got some of our favorite Italian Ice from Tom & Wendee's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Jen827
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Chicago for Lollapalooza. The hotel was a few blocks walk from Grant park and numberous "L" stations which was a perfect location. The room was nice, newly renovated, but we did have a room with a view of the white brick wall. No biggie, we weren't in Chicago to spend much time staring out the hotel room window anyway. The bed was very comfortable and the renovated bathroom and rain-style shower head were great. Overall nice hotel, no raves or complaints. Definitely work a package deal so you can save some money on the rate, but the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gms11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Blake is a beautiful hotel in an excellent location! The building is historic and fabulous, and the rooms are comfortable, roomy, and quiet. I would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TravelBlogger
Reviews.Content: My stay started off pleasantly enough, but at 6:30am on Saturday morning I was awoken by loud construction that did not abate. The staff at the hotel was not only unapologetic but they refused to do anything to alleviate the situation -- this includes moving me to another room, offering me a discounted rate, etc. What proceeded was a run-around by the management that dampened my stay. While I was excited by the fact that the hotel was new and a small boutique establishment rather than a chain, I quickly realized the lack competence and integrity. There are plenty of better places to stay in Chicago where you can be assured that the management will safeguard your need for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great stay”
Reviews.Author: cc49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blake from July 15-19 and was a little wary due to the reviews on this website. Most of the negative reviews are based on the fact that the hotel has been undergoing renovations over the past year. Well, the renovations were complete in the lobby and on my floor, and the hotel is beautiful! My room (616--a standard king) was very spacious (over 400 s.f.) and had a great view of the Chicago public library. Note: I highly recommend getting an even-numbered room, since the odd-numbered rooms face a rather unattractive white wall. The bed was large and comfortable, the flat-screen TV was great, and the spacious bathroom was finished in stylish marble and had a large vanity with two sinks--perfect for myself and my partner. My favorite part of the room was the new carpet--great style and great texture (I usually don't notice carpet, but this was wonderful)! The lobby was rather small and unremarkable, but attractive. I agree with others who have posted about the Orange restaurant around the corner--great for breakfast! And young Patrick the doorman was very helpful. The location is only one block south of the loop and within easy walking distance (5-10 minutes) to anything in the downtown area. I would stay here again! (I had to move to the Hotel Burnham--#1 in Chicago according to Tripadvisor--in the middle of the week due to a Priceline reservation, but I thought the rooms at the Blake were much nicer). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Blake”
Reviews.Author: Mac103
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Blake and were VERY pleased with our stay. The room was above average and very clean with a lovely bath and king sized bed. The location couldn't have been better. You had the choice of walking to many areas or taking the subway (which was a block and half away) or bus (across the street). We recommend buying a CTA visitors card for as many days as you plan to stay. We didn't eat in the hotel but for breakfast the Orange Juice Co. around the corner was excellent. Meals are large (we shared our breakfasts). Tourists visiting there on Saturdays should try the free "EL" tour that leaves from the Visitor's Center at the Cultural Center. The Chicago Trolley/Double Decker tour was excellent as well as the the river/lake boat tours (we used Wendella near the Wrigley Bldg.). All in all hotel and area made for a very enjoyable long weekend!
